Final Platform Layer  0.6.0.0
final_platform_layer.hpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /*
2 final_platform_layer.hpp
3 
4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5  About
6 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7 
8 A Open source C++ single file header platform abstraction layer library.
9 
10 Final Platform Layer is a cross-platform single-header-file development library designed to abstract the underlying platform to a very simple and easy to use low-level api for accessing input devices (keyboard, mouse, gamepad), audio playback, window handling, IO handling (files, directories, paths), multithreading (threads, mutex, signals) and graphics software or hardware rendering initialization.
11 The main focus is game/simulation development, so the default settings will create a window, setup a opengl rendering context and initialize audio playback on any platform.
12 The only dependencies are built-in operating system libraries, a C++/11 compiler and the C runtime library.
13 
14 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
15  Getting started
16 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
17 
18 - Drop this file into any C++ projects you want and include it in any place you want.
19 - In your main translation unit provide the typical main() entry point.
20 - Define FPL_IMPLEMENTATION before including this header file in at least one translation unit.
21 - Init the platform.
22 - Use the features you want.
23 - Release the platform when you are done.
24 
25 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
26  Usage: Hello world console application
27 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
28 
29 #define FPL_IMPLEMENTATION
30 #include <final_platform_layer.hpp>
31 
32 int main(int argc, char **args){
33  if (fpl::InitPlatform(fpl::InitFlags::None)) {
34  fpl::console::ConsoleOut("Hello World!\n");
35  fpl::ReleasePlatform();
36  return 0;
37  } else {
38  return -1;
39  }
40 }
41 
42 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
43  Usage: OpenGL legacy or modern application
44 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
45 
46 #define FPL_IMPLEMENTATION
47 #include <final_platform_layer.hpp>
48 
49 int main(int argc, char **args){
50  fpl::Settings settings = DefaultSettings();
51  fpl::VideoSettings &videoSettings = settings.video;
52 
53  videoSettings.driver = fpl::VideoDriverType::OpenGL;
54 
55  // Legacy OpenGL
56  videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags = fpl::OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Legacy;
57 
58  // or
59 
60  // Modern OpenGL
61  videoSettings.opengl.compabilityFlags = fpl::OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Core;
62  videoSettings.opengl.majorVersion = 3;
63  videoSettings.opengl.minorVersion = 3;
64 
65  if (fpl::InitPlatform(fpl::InitFlags::Video, settings)) {
66  // Event/Main loop
67  while (fpl::window::WindowUpdate()) {
68  // Handle actual window events
69  fpl::window::Event ev;
70  while (fpl::window::PollWindowEvent(ev)) {
72  }
73 
74  // your code goes here
75 
76  fpl::video::VideoFlip();
77  }
78  fpl::ReleasePlatform();
79  return 0;
80  } else {
81  return -1;
82  }
83 
84 }
85

545 // ****************************************************************************
546 //
547 // Header
548 //
549 // ****************************************************************************
550 #ifndef FPL_INCLUDE_HPP
551 #define FPL_INCLUDE_HPP
552 
553 // C++/11 detection
554 #if !((defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201103L)) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1900))
555 # error "You need a C++/11 compatible compiler for this library!"
556 #endif
557 
558 //
559 // Platform detection
560 //
561 // https://sourceforge.net/p/predef/wiki/OperatingSystems/
562 #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64)
563 # define FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
564 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "Windows"
565 #elif defined(__linux__) || defined(__gnu_linux__)
566 # define FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX
567 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "Linux"
568 # define FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX
569 # define FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11
570 #elif defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__NetBSD__) || defined(__OpenBSD__) || defined(__DragonFly__) || defined(__bsdi__)
571 # define FPL_PLATFORM_BSD
572 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "BSD"
573 # define FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX
574 # define FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11
575 # error "Not implemented yet!"
576 #elif defined(unix) || defined(__unix) || defined(__unix__)
577 # define FPL_PLATFORM_UNIX
578 # define FPL_PLATFORM_NAME "Unix"
579 # define FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX
580 # define FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11
581 # error "Not implemented yet!"
582 #else
583 # error "This platform is not supported!"
584 #endif // FPL_PLATFORM
585 
586 //
587 // Architecture detection (x86, x64)
588 // See: https://sourceforge.net/p/predef/wiki/Architectures/
589 //
590 #if defined(_M_X64) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__amd64__)
591 # define FPL_ARCH_X64
592 #elif defined(_M_IX86) || defined(__i386__) || defined(__X86__) || defined(_X86_)
593 # define FPL_ARCH_X86
594 #elif defined(__arm__) || defined(_M_ARM)
595 # if defined(__aarch64__)
596 # define FPL_ARCH_ARM64
597 # else
598 # define FPL_ARCH_ARM32
599 # endif
600 #else
601 # error "This architecture is not supported!"
602 #endif // FPL_ARCH
603 
604 //
605 // Build configuration and compilers
606 // See: http://beefchunk.com/documentation/lang/c/pre-defined-c/precomp.html
607 // See: http://nadeausoftware.com/articles/2012/10/c_c_tip_how_detect_compiler_name_and_version_using_compiler_predefined_macros
608 //
609 #if defined(__clang__)
610 # define FPL_COMPILER_CLANG
612 #elif defined(__llvm__)
613 # define FPL_COMPILER_LLVM
615 #elif defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
616 # define FPL_COMPILER_INTEL
618 #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
619 # define FPL_COMPILER_MINGW
621 #elif defined(__GNUG__) && !defined(__clang__)
622 # define FPL_COMPILER_GCC
624 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
625 # define FPL_COMPILER_MSVC
627 #else
628 # define FPL_COMPILER_UNKNOWN
630 #endif // FPL_COMPILER
631 
632 //
633 // Compiler depended settings and detections
634 //
635 #if defined(FPL_COMPILER_MSVC)
636 # pragma warning( disable : 4577 )
638 # pragma warning( disable : 4065 )
640 
641 # if defined(_DEBUG) || (!defined(NDEBUG))
642 # define FPL_ENABLE_DEBUG
644 # else
645 # define FPL_ENABLE_RELEASE
647 # endif
648 #else
649  // @NOTE(final): Expect all other compilers to pass in FPL_DEBUG manually
650 # if defined(FPL_DEBUG)
651 # define FPL_ENABLE_DEBUG
653 # else
654 # define FPL_ENABLE_RELEASE
656 # endif
657 #endif // FPL_COMPILER
658 
659 //
660 // Options & Feature detection
661 //
662 
663 // Assertions
664 #if !defined(FPL_NO_ASSERTIONS)
665 # if !defined(FPL_FORCE_ASSERTIONS)
666 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_DEBUG)
667 # define FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
669 # endif
670 # else
671 # define FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
673 # endif
674 #endif // !FPL_NO_ASSERTIONS
675 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS)
676 # if !defined(FPL_NO_C_ASSERT)
677 # define FPL_ENABLE_C_ASSERT
679 # endif
680 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
681 
682 // Window
683 #if !defined(FPL_NO_WINDOW)
684 # define FPL_SUPPORT_WINDOW
686 #endif
687 
688 // Video
689 #if !defined(FPL_NO_VIDEO)
690 # define FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO
692 #endif
693 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO)
694 # if !defined(FPL_NO_VIDEO_OPENGL)
695 # define FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL
697 # endif
698 # if !defined(FPL_NO_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
699 # define FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
701 # endif
702 #endif // FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO
703 
704 // Audio
705 #if !defined(FPL_NO_AUDIO)
706 # define FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO
708 #endif
709 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO)
710 # if !defined(FPL_NO_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND) && defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
711 # define FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND
713 # endif
714 #endif // FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO
715 
716 // Remove video support when window is disabled
717 #if !defined(FPL_SUPPORT_WINDOW)
718 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO)
719 # undef FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO
720 # endif
721 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL)
722 # undef FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL
723 # endif
724 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
725 # undef FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
726 # endif
727 #endif // !FPL_SUPPORT_WINDOW
728 
729 //
730 // Enable supports (FPL uses _ENABLE_ internally only)
731 //
732 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_WINDOW)
733 # define FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
735 #endif
736 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO)
737 # define FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
739 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_OPENGL)
740 # define FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
742 # endif
743 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
744 # define FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
746 # endif
747 #endif // FPL_SUPPORT_VIDEO
748 #if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO)
749 # define FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
751 # if defined(FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
752 # define FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND
754 # endif
755 #endif // FPL_SUPPORT_AUDIO
756 
757 #if !defined(FPL_NO_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE)
758 # define FPL_ENABLE_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE
760 #endif
761 #if !defined(FPL_NO_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
762 # define FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
764 #endif
765 #if defined(FPL_AUTO_NAMESPACE)
766 # define FPL_ENABLE_AUTO_NAMESPACE
768 #endif
769 
770 //
771 // Static/Inline/Extern/Internal
772 //
774 #define fpl_globalvar static
775 #define fpl_localvar static
777 #define fpl_internal static
779 #define fpl_inline inline
781 #define fpl_internal_inline fpl_internal fpl_inline
783 #define fpl_constant constexpr
785 
786 #if defined(FPL_API_AS_PRIVATE)
787 # define fpl_api static
789 #else
790 # define fpl_api extern
792 #endif // FPL_API_AS_PRIVATE
793 
795 #define fpl_platform_api fpl_api
796 #define fpl_common_api fpl_api
798 #define fpl_main
800 
801 //
802 // Assertions
803 //
804 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS)
805 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_C_ASSERT) && !defined(FPL_FORCE_ASSERTIONS)
806 # include <assert.h>
808 # define FPL_ASSERT(exp) assert(exp)
809 # define FPL_STATICASSERT(exp) static_assert(exp, "static_assert")
811 # else
812 # define FPL_ASSERT(exp) if(!(exp)) {*(int *)0 = 0;}
814 # define FPL_STATICASSERT_(exp, line) \
816  int fpl_static_assert_##line(int static_assert_failed[(exp)?1:-1])
817 # define FPL_STATICASSERT(exp) \
818  FPL_STATICASSERT_(exp, __LINE__)
819 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_C_ASSERT
820 #else
821 # define FPL_ASSERT(exp)
823 # define FPL_STATICASSERT(exp)
825 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS
826 
828 #define FPL_NOT_IMPLEMENTED {*(int *)0 = 0xBAD;}
829 
830 //
831 // Types & Limits
832 //
833 #include <stdint.h> // uint32_t, ...
834 #include <stddef.h> // size_t
835 #include <limits.h> // UINT32_MAX, ...
836 
837 //
838 // Macro functions
839 //
841 #define FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(arr) (sizeof(arr) / sizeof((arr)[0]))
842 
844 #define FPL_OFFSETOF(type, field) ((size_t)(&(((type*)(0))->field)))
845 
847 #define FPL_MIN(a, b) ((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b)
848 #define FPL_MAX(a, b) ((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b)
850 
852 #define FPL_KILOBYTES(value) (((value) * 1024ull))
853 #define FPL_MEGABYTES(value) ((FPL_KILOBYTES(value) * 1024ull))
855 #define FPL_GIGABYTES(value) ((FPL_MEGABYTES(value) * 1024ull))
857 #define FPL_TERABYTES(value) ((FPL_GIGABYTES(value) * 1024ull))
859 
861 #define FPL_IS_ALIGNED(ptr, alignment) (((uintptr_t)(const void *)(ptr)) % (alignment) == 0)
862 
864 #define FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(etype) \
865  inline etype operator | (etype lhs, etype rhs) { \
866  return (etype)(static_cast<int>(lhs) | static_cast<int>(rhs)); \
867  } \
868  inline bool operator & (const etype lhs, const etype rhs) { \
869  return (static_cast<int>(lhs) & static_cast<int>(rhs)) == static_cast<int>(rhs); \
870  } \
871  inline etype& operator |= (etype &lhs, etype rhs) { \
872  lhs = (etype)(static_cast<int>(lhs) | static_cast<int>(rhs)); \
873  return lhs; \
874  } \
875  inline etype& operator &= (etype &lhs, etype rhs) { \
876  lhs = (etype)(static_cast<int>(lhs) & static_cast<int>(rhs)); \
877  return lhs; \
878  }
879 
880 // ****************************************************************************
881 //
882 // Platform includes
883 //
884 // ****************************************************************************
885 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
886 // @NOTE(final): windef.h defines min/max macros defined in lowerspace, this will break for example std::min/max so we have to tell the header we dont want this!
887 # if !defined(NOMINMAX)
888 # define NOMINMAX
889 # endif
890 // @NOTE(final): For now we dont want any network, com or gdi stuff at all, maybe later who knows.
891 # if !defined(WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN)
892 # define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN 1
893 # endif
894 # include <windows.h> // Win32 api, its unfortunate we have to include this in the header as well, but there are structures
895 #endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
896 
897 #if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
898 # include <pthread.h> // pthread_t, pthread_mutex_, pthread_cond_, pthread_barrier_
899 #endif // FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX
900 
901 #if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11)
902 # include <X11/X.h> // XVisualInfo
903 # include <X11/Xlib.h> // ???
904 #endif
905 
906 // ****************************************************************************
907 //
908 // API Declaration
909 //
910 // ****************************************************************************
911 
913 namespace fpl {
915  namespace atomics {
927  fpl_platform_api void AtomicReadFence();
932  fpl_platform_api void AtomicWriteFence();
937  fpl_platform_api void AtomicReadWriteFence();
938 
946  fpl_platform_api uint32_t AtomicExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *target, const uint32_t value);
954  fpl_platform_api uint64_t AtomicExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *target, const uint64_t value);
962  fpl_platform_api int32_t AtomicExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *target, const int32_t value);
970  fpl_platform_api int64_t AtomicExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *target, const int64_t value);
978  fpl_common_api void *AtomicExchangePtr(volatile void **target, const void *value);
979 
987  fpl_platform_api uint32_t AtomicAddU32(volatile uint32_t *value, const uint32_t addend);
995  fpl_platform_api uint64_t AtomicAddU64(volatile uint64_t *value, const uint64_t addend);
1003  fpl_platform_api int32_t AtomicAddS32(volatile int32_t *value, const int32_t addend);
1011  fpl_platform_api int64_t AtomicAddS64(volatile int64_t *value, const int64_t addend);
1012 
1022  fpl_platform_api uint32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange);
1032  fpl_platform_api uint64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange);
1042  fpl_platform_api int32_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange);
1052  fpl_platform_api int64_t AtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange);
1062  fpl_common_api void *AtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange);
1063 
1072  fpl_platform_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t comparand, const uint32_t exchange);
1081  fpl_platform_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t comparand, const uint64_t exchange);
1090  fpl_platform_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t comparand, const int32_t exchange);
1099  fpl_platform_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t comparand, const int64_t exchange);
1108  fpl_common_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange);
1109 
1117  fpl_platform_api uint32_t AtomicLoadU32(volatile uint32_t *source);
1125  fpl_platform_api uint64_t AtomicLoadU64(volatile uint64_t *source);
1133  fpl_platform_api int32_t AtomicLoadS32(volatile int32_t *source);
1141  fpl_platform_api int64_t AtomicLoadS64(volatile int64_t *source);
1149  fpl_common_api void *AtomicLoadPtr(volatile void **source);
1150 
1158  fpl_platform_api void AtomicStoreU32(volatile uint32_t *dest, const uint32_t value);
1166  fpl_platform_api void AtomicStoreU64(volatile uint64_t *dest, const uint64_t value);
1174  fpl_platform_api void AtomicStoreS32(volatile int32_t *dest, const int32_t value);
1182  fpl_platform_api void AtomicStoreS64(volatile int64_t *dest, const int64_t value);
1190  fpl_common_api void AtomicStorePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *value);
1191 
1193  }
1194 
1196  namespace hardware {
1203  struct MemoryInfos {
1206  uint64_t totalPhysicalSize;
1208  uint64_t availablePhysicalSize;
1210  uint64_t usedPhysicalSize;
1212  uint64_t totalVirtualSize;
1214  uint64_t usedVirtualSize;
1216  uint64_t totalPageSize;
1218  uint64_t usedPageSize;
1219  };
1220 
1225  fpl_platform_api uint32_t GetProcessorCoreCount();
1233  fpl_platform_api char *GetProcessorName(char *destBuffer, const uint32_t maxDestBufferLen);
1238  fpl_platform_api MemoryInfos GetSystemMemoryInfos();
1239 
1241  }
1242 
1249  enum class InitFlags : int {
1252  None = 0,
1254  Window = 1 << 0,
1256  Video = 1 << 1,
1258  Audio = 1 << 2,
1260  All = Window | Video | Audio
1261  };
1263  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(InitFlags);
1264 
1266  enum class VideoDriverType {
1268  None,
1270  OpenGL,
1272  Software
1273  };
1274 
1275 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
1276  enum class OpenGLCompabilityFlags : uint32_t {
1279  Legacy = 0,
1281  Core = 1 << 1,
1283  Compability = 1 << 2,
1285  Forward = 1 << 3,
1286  };
1288  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(OpenGLCompabilityFlags);
1289 
1291  struct OpenGLVideoSettings {
1293  OpenGLCompabilityFlags compabilityFlags;
1295  uint32_t majorVersion;
1297  uint32_t minorVersion;
1298  };
1299 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
1300 
1302  struct VideoSettings {
1304  VideoDriverType driver;
1306  bool isVSync;
1308  bool isAutoSize;
1310  union {
1311 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
1312  OpenGLVideoSettings opengl;
1313 # endif
1314  } graphics;
1315  };
1316 
1321  fpl_inline VideoSettings DefaultVideoSettings() {
1322  VideoSettings result = {};
1323 
1324  result.isVSync = false;
1325  result.isAutoSize = true;
1326 
1327  // @NOTE(final): Auto detect video driver
1328 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
1329  result.driver = VideoDriverType::OpenGL;
1330  result.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags = OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Legacy;
1331 # elif defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
1332  result.driver = VideoDriverType::Software;
1333 # else
1334  result.driver = VideoDriverType::None;
1335 # endif
1336 
1337  return(result);
1338  }
1339 
1341  enum class AudioDriverType {
1343  None,
1345  Auto,
1347  DirectSound,
1348  };
1349 
1351  enum class AudioFormatType : uint32_t {
1352  // No audio format
1353  None,
1354  // Unsigned 8-bit integer PCM
1355  U8,
1356  // Signed 16-bit integer PCM
1357  S16,
1358  // Signed 24-bit integer PCM
1359  S24,
1360  // Signed 32-bit integer PCM
1361  S32,
1362  // Signed 64-bit integer PCM
1363  S64,
1364  // 32-bit IEEE_FLOAT
1365  F32,
1366  // 64-bit IEEE_FLOAT
1367  F64,
1368  };
1369 
1371  struct AudioDeviceFormat {
1373  AudioFormatType type;
1375  uint32_t sampleRate;
1377  uint32_t channels;
1379  uint32_t periods;
1381  uint32_t bufferSizeInBytes;
1383  uint32_t bufferSizeInFrames;
1384  };
1385 
1387  struct AudioDeviceID {
1389  char name[256];
1390  union {
1391 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
1392  GUID dshow;
1394 # endif
1395  };
1396  };
1397 
1399  typedef uint32_t(AudioClientReadFunction)(const AudioDeviceFormat &deviceFormat, const uint32_t frameCount, void *outputSamples, void *userData);
1400 
1402  struct AudioSettings {
1404  AudioDeviceFormat deviceFormat;
1406  AudioDeviceID deviceID;
1408  AudioClientReadFunction *clientReadCallback;
1410  AudioDriverType driver;
1412  uint32_t bufferSizeInMilliSeconds;
1414  bool preferExclusiveMode;
1416  void *userData;
1417  };
1418 
1423  fpl_inline AudioSettings DefaultAudioSettings() {
1424  AudioSettings result = {};
1425  result.bufferSizeInMilliSeconds = 25;
1426  result.preferExclusiveMode = false;
1427  result.deviceFormat.channels = 2;
1428  result.deviceFormat.sampleRate = 48000;
1429  result.deviceFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S16;
1430 
1431  result.driver = AudioDriverType::None;
1432 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1433 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
1434  result.driver = AudioDriverType::DirectSound;
1435 # endif
1436 # endif
1437  return(result);
1438  }
1439 
1441  struct WindowSettings {
1443  char windowTitle[256];
1445  uint32_t windowWidth;
1447  uint32_t windowHeight;
1449  uint32_t fullscreenWidth;
1451  uint32_t fullscreenHeight;
1453  bool isResizable;
1455  bool isFullscreen;
1456  };
1457 
1462  fpl_inline WindowSettings DefaultWindowSettings() {
1463  WindowSettings result = {};
1464  result.windowTitle[0] = 0;
1465  result.windowWidth = 800;
1466  result.windowHeight = 600;
1467  result.fullscreenWidth = 0;
1468  result.fullscreenHeight = 0;
1469  result.isResizable = true;
1470  result.isFullscreen = false;
1471  return(result);
1472  }
1473 
1475  struct InputSettings {
1477  uint32_t controllerDetectionFrequency;
1478  };
1479 
1484  fpl_inline InputSettings DefaultInputSettings() {
1485  InputSettings result = {};
1486  result.controllerDetectionFrequency = 100;
1487  return(result);
1488  }
1489 
1491  struct PrepareWindowForVideoResult {
1493  union {
1494 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1495  struct {
1497  // @NOTE(final): Win32 does not require to do anything before the window is created
1498  } win32;
1499 # endif
1500 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11)
1501  struct {
1504  XVisualInfo *visualInfo;
1505  } x11;
1506 # endif
1507  } window;
1509  bool wasSuccessful;
1510  };
1511 
1513 # define FPL_FUNC_PREPARE_WINDOW_FOR_VIDEO_BEFORE(name) PrepareWindowForVideoResult name(const VideoSettings &videoSettings, void *userData)
1514  typedef FPL_FUNC_PREPARE_WINDOW_FOR_VIDEO_BEFORE(callback_PrepareWindowForVideoBefore);
1516 
1518  struct WindowForVideoSettings {
1520  void *userData;
1522  callback_PrepareWindowForVideoBefore *beforeCallback;
1523  };
1524 
1526  struct Settings {
1528  WindowSettings window;
1530  VideoSettings video;
1532  AudioSettings audio;
1534  InputSettings input;
1536  WindowForVideoSettings windowForVideo;
1537  };
1538 
1543  fpl_inline Settings DefaultSettings() {
1544  Settings result = {};
1545  result.window = DefaultWindowSettings();
1546  result.video = DefaultVideoSettings();
1547  result.audio = DefaultAudioSettings();
1548  result.input = DefaultInputSettings();
1549  return(result);
1550  }
1551

1703 
1705  namespace threading {
1712  enum class ThreadState : uint32_t {
1715  Stopped,
1717  Starting,
1719  Running,
1721  Stopping,
1722  };
1723 
1724  struct ThreadContext;
1726  typedef void (run_thread_function)(const ThreadContext &context, void *data);
1727 
1729  struct ThreadContext {
1731  uint64_t id;
1733  run_thread_function *runFunc;
1735  void *data;
1737  union {
1738 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1739  struct {
1740  HANDLE handle;
1741  } win32;
1742 # endif
1743 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
1744  struct {
1745  pthread_t thread;
1746  pthread_mutex_t mutex;
1747  pthread_cond_t stopCondition;
1748  } posix;
1749 # endif
1750  } internalHandle;
1752  volatile ThreadState currentState;
1754  volatile bool isValid;
1756  volatile bool isStopping;
1757  };
1758 
1760  struct ThreadMutex {
1762  union {
1763 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1764  struct {
1765  CRITICAL_SECTION criticalSection;
1766  } win32;
1767 # endif
1768 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
1769  struct {
1770  pthread_mutex_t mutex;
1771  } posix;
1772 # endif
1773  } internalHandle;
1774  bool isValid;
1775  };
1776 
1778  struct ThreadSignal {
1780  union {
1781 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
1782  struct {
1783  HANDLE eventHandle;
1784  } win32;
1785 # endif
1786 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
1787  struct {
1788  pthread_cond_t condition;
1789  } posix;
1790 # endif
1791  } internalHandle;
1793  bool isValid;
1794  };
1795 
1797  fpl_inline ThreadState GetThreadState(ThreadContext *thread) {
1798  if(thread == nullptr) {
1799  return ThreadState::Stopped;
1800  }
1801  ThreadState result = (ThreadState)atomics::AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)&thread->currentState);
1802  return(result);
1803  }
1804 
1813  fpl_platform_api ThreadContext *ThreadCreate(run_thread_function *runFunc, void *data);
1819  fpl_platform_api void ThreadSleep(const uint32_t milliseconds);
1826  fpl_platform_api void ThreadDestroy(ThreadContext *context);
1833  fpl_platform_api bool ThreadWaitForOne(ThreadContext *context, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1841  fpl_platform_api bool ThreadWaitForAll(ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1849  fpl_platform_api bool ThreadWaitForAny(ThreadContext *contexts[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1850 
1856  fpl_platform_api ThreadMutex MutexCreate();
1861  fpl_platform_api void MutexDestroy(ThreadMutex &mutex);
1868  fpl_platform_api bool MutexLock(ThreadMutex &mutex, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1874  fpl_platform_api bool MutexUnlock(ThreadMutex &mutex);
1875 
1881  fpl_platform_api ThreadSignal SignalCreate();
1886  fpl_platform_api void SignalDestroy(ThreadSignal &signal);
1894  fpl_platform_api bool SignalWaitForOne(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal &signal, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1903  fpl_platform_api bool SignalWaitForAll(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1912  fpl_platform_api bool SignalWaitForAny(ThreadMutex &mutex, ThreadSignal *signals[], const uint32_t count, const uint32_t maxMilliseconds = UINT32_MAX);
1918  fpl_platform_api bool SignalSet(ThreadSignal &signal);
1919 
1921  }

2142  namespace files {
2149  struct FileHandle {
2152  union {
2153 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2154  struct {
2155  HANDLE handle;
2156  } win32;
2157 # endif
2158 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
2159  struct {
2160  int handle;
2161  } posix;
2162 # endif
2163  } internalHandle;
2165  bool isValid;
2166  };
2167 
2169  enum class FilePositionMode {
2171  Beginning,
2173  Current,
2175  End
2176  };
2177 
2179  enum class FileEntryType {
2181  Unknown,
2183  File,
2185  Directory
2186  };
2187 
2189  enum class FileAttributeFlags : int {
2191  None = 0,
2193  Normal = 1 << 0,
2195  ReadOnly = 1 << 1,
2197  Hidden = 1 << 2,
2199  Archive = 1 << 3,
2201  System = 1 << 4
2202  };
2204  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(FileAttributeFlags);
2205 
2207  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_FILEENTRY_PATH_LENGTH = 1024;
2208 
2210  struct FileEntry {
2212  FileEntryType type;
2214  FileAttributeFlags attributes;
2216  char path[MAX_FILEENTRY_PATH_LENGTH];
2218  union {
2219 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
2220  struct {
2221  HANDLE fileHandle;
2222  } win32;
2223 # endif
2224 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
2225  struct {
2226  int fileHandle;
2227  } posix;
2228 # endif
2229  } internalHandle;
2230  };
2231

2457 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
2458  namespace window {
2466  enum class Key {
2468  Key_None = 0,
2469 
2470  // 0x07: Undefined
2471 
2472  Key_Backspace = 0x08,
2473  Key_Tab = 0x09,
2474 
2475  // 0x0A-0x0B: Reserved
2476 
2477  Key_Clear = 0x0C,
2478  Key_Enter = 0x0D,
2479 
2480  // 0x0E-0x0F: Undefined
2481 
2482  Key_Shift = 0x10,
2483  Key_Control = 0x11,
2484  Key_Alt = 0x12,
2485  Key_Pause = 0x13,
2486  Key_CapsLock = 0x14,
2487 
2488  // 0x15: IME-Keys
2489  // 0x16: Undefined
2490  // 0x17-0x19 IME-Keys
2491  // 0x1A: Undefined
2492 
2493  Key_Escape = 0x1B,
2494 
2495  // 0x1C - 0x1F: IME-Keys
2496 
2497  Key_Space = 0x20,
2498  Key_PageUp = 0x21,
2499  Key_PageDown = 0x22,
2500  Key_End = 0x23,
2501  Key_Home = 0x24,
2502  Key_Left = 0x25,
2503  Key_Up = 0x26,
2504  Key_Right = 0x27,
2505  Key_Down = 0x28,
2506  Key_Select = 0x29,
2507  Key_Print = 0x2A,
2508  Key_Execute = 0x2B,
2509  Key_Snapshot = 0x2C,
2510  Key_Insert = 0x2D,
2511  Key_Delete = 0x2E,
2512  Key_Help = 0x2F,
2513 
2514  Key_0 = 0x30,
2515  Key_1 = 0x31,
2516  Key_2 = 0x32,
2517  Key_3 = 0x33,
2518  Key_4 = 0x34,
2519  Key_5 = 0x35,
2520  Key_6 = 0x36,
2521  Key_7 = 0x37,
2522  Key_8 = 0x38,
2523  Key_9 = 0x39,
2524 
2525  // 0x3A-0x40: Undefined
2526 
2527  Key_A = 0x41,
2528  Key_B = 0x42,
2529  Key_C = 0x43,
2530  Key_D = 0x44,
2531  Key_E = 0x45,
2532  Key_F = 0x46,
2533  Key_G = 0x47,
2534  Key_H = 0x48,
2535  Key_I = 0x49,
2536  Key_J = 0x4A,
2537  Key_K = 0x4B,
2538  Key_L = 0x4C,
2539  Key_M = 0x4D,
2540  Key_N = 0x4E,
2541  Key_O = 0x4F,
2542  Key_P = 0x50,
2543  Key_Q = 0x51,
2544  Key_R = 0x52,
2545  Key_S = 0x53,
2546  Key_T = 0x54,
2547  Key_U = 0x55,
2548  Key_V = 0x56,
2549  Key_W = 0x57,
2550  Key_X = 0x58,
2551  Key_Y = 0x59,
2552  Key_Z = 0x5A,
2553 
2554  Key_LeftWin = 0x5B,
2555  Key_RightWin = 0x5C,
2556  Key_Apps = 0x5D,
2557 
2558  // 0x5E: Reserved
2559 
2560  Key_Sleep = 0x5F,
2561  Key_NumPad0 = 0x60,
2562  Key_NumPad1 = 0x61,
2563  Key_NumPad2 = 0x62,
2564  Key_NumPad3 = 0x63,
2565  Key_NumPad4 = 0x64,
2566  Key_NumPad5 = 0x65,
2567  Key_NumPad6 = 0x66,
2568  Key_NumPad7 = 0x67,
2569  Key_NumPad8 = 0x68,
2570  Key_NumPad9 = 0x69,
2571  Key_Multiply = 0x6A,
2572  Key_Add = 0x6B,
2573  Key_Separator = 0x6C,
2574  Key_Substract = 0x6D,
2575  Key_Decimal = 0x6E,
2576  Key_Divide = 0x6F,
2577  Key_F1 = 0x70,
2578  Key_F2 = 0x71,
2579  Key_F3 = 0x72,
2580  Key_F4 = 0x73,
2581  Key_F5 = 0x74,
2582  Key_F6 = 0x75,
2583  Key_F7 = 0x76,
2584  Key_F8 = 0x77,
2585  Key_F9 = 0x78,
2586  Key_F10 = 0x79,
2587  Key_F11 = 0x7A,
2588  Key_F12 = 0x7B,
2589  Key_F13 = 0x7C,
2590  Key_F14 = 0x7D,
2591  Key_F15 = 0x7E,
2592  Key_F16 = 0x7F,
2593  Key_F17 = 0x80,
2594  Key_F18 = 0x81,
2595  Key_F19 = 0x82,
2596  Key_F20 = 0x83,
2597  Key_F21 = 0x84,
2598  Key_F22 = 0x85,
2599  Key_F23 = 0x86,
2600  Key_F24 = 0x87,
2601 
2602  // 0x88-8F: Unassigned
2603 
2604  Key_NumLock = 0x90,
2605  Key_Scroll = 0x91,
2606 
2607  // 0x92-9x96: OEM specific
2608  // 0x97-0x9F: Unassigned
2609 
2610  Key_LeftShift = 0xA0,
2611  Key_RightShift = 0xA1,
2612  Key_LeftControl = 0xA2,
2613  Key_RightControl = 0xA3,
2614  Key_LeftAlt = 0xA4,
2615  Key_RightAlt = 0xA5,
2616 
2617  // 0xA6-0xFE: Dont care
2618  };
2619 
2621  enum class WindowEventType {
2623  Resized,
2625  GotFocus,
2627  LostFocus,
2628  };

2631  struct WindowEvent {

2637  uint32_t height;
2638  };
2639 
2641  enum class KeyboardEventType {
2643  KeyDown,
2645  KeyUp,
2647  CharInput,
2648  };
2649 
2651  enum class KeyboardModifierFlags : int {
2653  None = 0,
2655  Alt = 1 << 0,
2657  Ctrl = 1 << 1,
2659  Shift = 1 << 2,
2661  Super = 1 << 3,
2662  };
2664  FPL_ENUM_AS_FLAGS_OPERATORS(KeyboardModifierFlags);
2665 
2667  struct KeyboardEvent {
2669  KeyboardEventType type;
2671  uint64_t keyCode;
2673  Key mappedKey;
2675  KeyboardModifierFlags modifiers;
2676  };
2677 
2679  enum class MouseEventType {
2681  Move,
2683  ButtonDown,
2685  ButtonUp,
2687  Wheel,
2688  };
2689 
2691  enum class MouseButtonType : int {
2693  None = -1,
2695  Left = 0,
2697  Right = 1,
2699  Middle = 2,
2700  };
2701 
2703  struct MouseEvent {
2705  MouseEventType type;
2707  MouseButtonType mouseButton;
2709  int32_t mouseX;
2711  int32_t mouseY;
2713  float wheelDelta;
2714  };
2715 
2717  enum class GamepadEventType {
2719  None,
2721  Connected,
2723  Disconnected,
2725  StateChanged,
2726  };
2727 
2729  struct GamepadButton {
2731  bool isDown;
2732  };
2733 
2735  struct GamepadState {
2736  union {
2737  struct {
2739  GamepadButton dpadUp;
2741  GamepadButton dpadRight;
2743  GamepadButton dpadDown;
2745  GamepadButton dpadLeft;
2746 
2748  GamepadButton actionA;
2750  GamepadButton actionB;
2752  GamepadButton actionX;
2754  GamepadButton actionY;
2755 
2757  GamepadButton start;
2759  GamepadButton back;
2760 
2762  GamepadButton leftThumb;
2764  GamepadButton rightThumb;
2765 
2767  GamepadButton leftShoulder;
2769  GamepadButton rightShoulder;
2770  };
2771 
2773  GamepadButton buttons[14];
2774  };
2775 
2777  float leftStickX;
2779  float leftStickY;
2781  float rightStickX;
2783  float rightStickY;
2784 
2786  float leftTrigger;
2788  float rightTrigger;
2789  };
2790 
2792  struct GamepadEvent {
2794  GamepadEventType type;
2796  uint32_t deviceIndex;
2798  GamepadState state;
2799  };
2800 
2802  enum class EventType {
2804  Window,
2806  Keyboard,
2808  Mouse,
2810  Gamepad,
2811  };
2812 
2814  struct Event {
2816  EventType type;
2817  union {
2819  WindowEvent window;
2821  KeyboardEvent keyboard;
2823  MouseEvent mouse;
2825  GamepadEvent gamepad;
2826  };
2827  };

2907  fpl_platform_api bool IsWindowResizable();
2912  fpl_platform_api void SetWindowResizeable(const bool value);
2921  fpl_platform_api bool SetWindowFullscreen(const bool value, const uint32_t fullscreenWidth = 0, const uint32_t fullscreenHeight = 0, const uint32_t refreshRate = 0);
2926  fpl_platform_api bool IsWindowFullscreen();
2931  fpl_platform_api WindowPosition GetWindowPosition();
2937  fpl_platform_api void SetWindowPosition(const int32_t left, const int32_t top);
2942  fpl_platform_api void SetWindowTitle(const char *title);
2943 
2944  /*\}*/
2945 
2958  fpl_platform_api char *GetClipboardAnsiText(char *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen);
2965  fpl_platform_api wchar_t *GetClipboardWideText(wchar_t *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen);
2971  fpl_platform_api bool SetClipboardText(const char *ansiSource);
2977  fpl_platform_api bool SetClipboardText(const wchar_t *wideSource);
2978 
2980  };
2981 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
2982 
2983 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
2984  namespace video {
2992  struct VideoRect {
2995  int32_t x;
2997  int32_t y;
2999  int32_t width;
3001  int32_t height;
3002  };
3003 
3012  fpl_inline VideoRect CreateVideoRectFromLTRB(int32_t left, int32_t top, int32_t right, int32_t bottom) {
3013  VideoRect result = { left, top, (right - left) + 1, (bottom - top) + 1 };
3014  return(result);
3015  }
3016 
3022  fpl_inline const char *GetVideoDriverString(VideoDriverType driver) {
3023  fpl_constant char *VIDEO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS[] = {
3024  "None",
3025  "OpenGL",
3026  "Software",
3027  };
3028  uint32_t index = (uint32_t)driver;
3029  FPL_ASSERT(index < FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(VIDEO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS));
3030  const char *result = VIDEO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS[index];
3031  return(result);
3032  }
3033 
3034 
3036  struct VideoBackBuffer {
3038  uint32_t *pixels;
3040  uint32_t width;
3042  uint32_t height;
3044  size_t pixelStride;
3046  size_t lineWidth;
3048  VideoRect outputRect;
3050  bool useOutputRect;
3051  };
3052 
3058  fpl_common_api VideoBackBuffer *GetVideoBackBuffer();
3065  fpl_common_api bool ResizeVideoBackBuffer(const uint32_t width, const uint32_t height);
3070  fpl_common_api VideoDriverType GetVideoDriver();
3071 
3075  fpl_common_api void VideoFlip();
3076 
3078  };
3079 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
3080 
3081 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
3082  namespace audio {
3090  enum class AudioResult {
3092  Success,
3093  DeviceNotInitialized,
3094  DeviceAlreadyStopped,
3095  DeviceAlreadyStarted,
3096  DeviceBusy,
3097  Failed,
3098  };
3099 
3104  fpl_common_api AudioResult PlayAudio();
3109  fpl_common_api AudioResult StopAudio();
3114  fpl_common_api AudioDeviceFormat GetAudioHardwareFormat();
3121  fpl_common_api void SetAudioClientReadCallback(AudioClientReadFunction *newCallback, void *userData);
3128  fpl_common_api uint32_t GetAudioDevices(AudioDeviceID *devices, uint32_t maxDeviceCount);
3129 
3135  fpl_inline uint32_t GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(const AudioFormatType format) {
3136  switch(format) {
3137  case AudioFormatType::U8:
3138  return 1;
3139  case AudioFormatType::S16:
3140  return 2;
3141  case AudioFormatType::S24:
3142  return 3;
3143  case AudioFormatType::S32:
3144  case AudioFormatType::F32:
3145  return 4;
3146  case AudioFormatType::S64:
3147  case AudioFormatType::F64:
3148  return 8;
3149  default:
3150  return 0;
3151  }
3152  }
3153 
3159  fpl_inline const char *GetAudioFormatString(const AudioFormatType format) {
3160  // @NOTE(final): Order must be equal to the AudioFormatType enum!
3161  fpl_constant char *AUDIO_FORMAT_TYPE_STRINGS[] = {
3162  "None",
3163  "U8",
3164  "S16",
3165  "S24",
3166  "S32",
3167  "S64",
3168  "F32",
3169  "F64",
3170  };
3171  uint32_t index = (uint32_t)format;
3172  FPL_ASSERT(index < FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(AUDIO_FORMAT_TYPE_STRINGS));
3173  const char *result = AUDIO_FORMAT_TYPE_STRINGS[index];
3174  return(result);
3175  }
3176 
3182  fpl_inline const char *GetAudioDriverString(AudioDriverType driver) {
3183  fpl_constant char *AUDIO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS[] = {
3184  "None",
3185  "Auto",
3186  "DirectSound",
3187  };
3188  uint32_t index = (uint32_t)driver;
3189  FPL_ASSERT(index < FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(AUDIO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS));
3190  const char *result = AUDIO_DRIVER_TYPE_STRINGS[index];
3191  return(result);
3192  }
3193 
3200  fpl_inline uint32_t GetAudioBufferSizeInFrames(uint32_t sampleRate, uint32_t bufferSizeInMilliSeconds) {
3201  uint32_t result = (sampleRate / 1000) * bufferSizeInMilliSeconds;
3202  return(result);
3203  }
3204 
3211  fpl_inline uint32_t GetAudioFrameSizeInBytes(const AudioFormatType format, const uint32_t channelCount) {
3212  uint32_t result = GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(format) * channelCount;
3213  return(result);
3214  }
3215 
3223  fpl_inline uint32_t GetAudioBufferSizeInBytes(const AudioFormatType format, const uint32_t channelCount, const uint32_t frameCount) {
3224  uint32_t frameSize = GetAudioFrameSizeInBytes(format, channelCount);
3225  uint32_t result = frameSize * frameCount;
3226  return(result);
3227  }
3228 
3230  };
3231 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
3232 }

3316  typedef FPL_XINPUT_GET_STATE(win32_func_XInputGetState);
3317  FPL_XINPUT_GET_STATE(Win32XInputGetStateStub) {
3318  return(ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED);
3319  }

3322  FPL_XINPUT_GET_CAPABILITIES(Win32XInputGetCapabilitiesStub) {

3324  }

3475  typedef FPL_FUNC_GET_FOREGROUND_WINDOW(win32_func_GetForegroundWindow);

3477 # define FPL_FUNC_IS_ZOOMED(name) BOOL WINAPI name(HWND hWnd)
3478  typedef FPL_FUNC_IS_ZOOMED(win32_func_IsZoomed);
3479 # define FPL_FUNC_SEND_MESSAGE_A(name) LRESULT WINAPI name(HWND hWnd, UINT Msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
3480  typedef FPL_FUNC_SEND_MESSAGE_A(win32_func_SendMessageA);
3481 # define FPL_FUNC_SEND_MESSAGE_W(name) LRESULT WINAPI name(HWND hWnd, UINT Msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
3482  typedef FPL_FUNC_SEND_MESSAGE_W(win32_func_SendMessageW);
3483 # define FPL_FUNC_GET_MONITOR_INFO_A(name) BOOL WINAPI name(HMONITOR hMonitor, LPMONITORINFO lpmi)
3484  typedef FPL_FUNC_GET_MONITOR_INFO_A(win32_func_GetMonitorInfoA);
3485 # define FPL_FUNC_GET_MONITOR_INFO_W(name) BOOL WINAPI name(HMONITOR hMonitor, LPMONITORINFO lpmi)
3486  typedef FPL_FUNC_GET_MONITOR_INFO_W(win32_func_GetMonitorInfoW);
3487 # define FPL_FUNC_MONITOR_FROM_RECT(name) HMONITOR WINAPI name(LPCRECT lprc, DWORD dwFlags)

3701 #if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_POSIX)
3702 namespace fpl {
3703  namespace platform {
3704 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_CREATE(name) int name(pthread_t *, const pthread_attr_t *, void *(*__start_routine) (void *), void *)
3705  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_CREATE(pthread_func_pthread_create);
3706 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_KILL(name) int name(pthread_t thread, int sig)
3707  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_KILL(pthread_func_pthread_kill);
3708 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_JOIN(name) int name(pthread_t __th, void **__thread_return)
3709  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_JOIN(pthread_func_pthread_join);
3710 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_EXIT(name) void name(void *__retval)
3711  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_EXIT(pthread_func_pthread_exit);
3712 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_YIELD(name) int name(void)
3713  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_YIELD(pthread_func_pthread_yield);
3714 
3715 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT(name) int name(pthread_mutex_t *mutex, const pthread_mutexattr_t *attr)
3716  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT(pthread_func_pthread_mutex_init);
3717 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_DESTROY(name) int name(pthread_mutex_t *mutex)
3718  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_DESTROY(pthread_func_pthread_mutex_destroy);
3719 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_LOCK(name) int name(pthread_mutex_t *mutex)
3720  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_LOCK(pthread_func_pthread_mutex_lock);
3721 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_TRYLOCK(name) int name(pthread_mutex_t *mutex)
3722  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_TRYLOCK(pthread_func_pthread_mutex_trylock);
3723 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_UNLOCK(name) int name(pthread_mutex_t *mutex)
3724  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_MUTEX_UNLOCK(pthread_func_pthread_mutex_unlock);
3725 
3726 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_INIT(name) int name(pthread_cond_t *cond, const pthread_condattr_t *attr)
3727  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_INIT(pthread_func_pthread_cond_init);
3728 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_DESTROY(name) int name(pthread_cond_t *cond)
3729  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_DESTROY(pthread_func_pthread_cond_destroy);
3730 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_TIMEDWAIT(name) int name(pthread_cond_t *cond, pthread_mutex_t *mutex, const struct timespec *abstime)
3731  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_TIMEDWAIT(pthread_func_pthread_cond_timedwait);
3732 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_WAIT(name) int name(pthread_cond_t *cond, pthread_mutex_t *mutex)
3733  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_WAIT(pthread_func_pthread_cond_wait);
3734 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_BROADCAST(name) int name(pthread_cond_t *cond)
3735  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_BROADCAST(pthread_func_pthread_cond_broadcast);
3736 # define FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_SIGNAL(name) int name(pthread_cond_t *cond)
3737  typedef FPL_FUNC_PTHREAD_COND_SIGNAL(pthread_func_pthread_cond_signal);
3738

3744  pthread_func_pthread_join *pthread_join;

3750  pthread_func_pthread_mutex_lock *pthread_mutex_lock;
3751  pthread_func_pthread_mutex_trylock *pthread_mutex_trylock;
3752  pthread_func_pthread_mutex_unlock *pthread_mutex_unlock;
3753 
3754  pthread_func_pthread_cond_init *pthread_cond_init;
3755  pthread_func_pthread_cond_destroy *pthread_cond_destroy;
3756  pthread_func_pthread_cond_timedwait *pthread_cond_timedwait;
3757  pthread_func_pthread_cond_wait *pthread_cond_wait;
3758  pthread_func_pthread_cond_broadcast *pthread_cond_broadcast;
3759  pthread_func_pthread_cond_signal *pthread_cond_signal;
3760  };

3792 // ****************************************************************************
3793 //
3794 // All Platforms & Forward Declarations
3795 //
3796 // ****************************************************************************
3797 namespace fpl {
3798  namespace platform {
3799  //
3800  // Platform initialization state
3801  //
3802  struct PlatformInitState {
3803  union {
3804 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
3805  Win32InitState win32;
3806 # endif
3807 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX)
3808  LinuxInitState linux;
3809 # endif
3810  };
3811  bool isInitialized;
3812  };
3813  fpl_globalvar PlatformInitState global__InitState = {};
3814 
3815 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
3816  struct PlatformWindowState {
3817  union {
3818 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
3819  Win32WindowState win32;
3820 # endif
3821  };
3822  };
3823 # endif
3824 
3825 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
3826  struct PlatformVideoState {
3827  void *mem; // Points to common::VideoState
3828  size_t memSize;
3829  };
3830 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
3831 
3832 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
3833  struct PlatformAudioState {
3834  void *mem; // Points to common::AudioState
3835  size_t memSize;
3836  };
3837 # endif
3838 
3839  //
3840  // Platform application state
3841  //
3842  struct PlatformAppState {
3843  union {
3844 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
3845  Win32AppState win32;
3846 # endif
3847 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX)
3848  LinuxAppState linux;
3849 # endif
3850  };
3851 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
3852  PlatformWindowState window;
3853 # endif
3854 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
3855  PlatformVideoState video;
3856 # endif
3857 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
3858  PlatformAudioState audio;
3859 # endif
3860  Settings initSettings;
3861  Settings currentSettings;
3862  InitFlags initFlags;
3863  };
3864 
3865 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
3866  // @TODO(final): Move event queue into PlatformWindowState
3867  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_EVENT_COUNT = 32768;
3868  struct EventQueue {
3869  window::Event events[MAX_EVENT_COUNT];
3870  volatile uint32_t pollIndex;
3871  volatile uint32_t pushCount;
3872  };
3873  fpl_globalvar EventQueue *global__EventQueue = nullptr;
3874 
3875  fpl_internal_inline void PushEvent(const window::Event &event) {
3876  EventQueue *eventQueue = global__EventQueue;
3877  FPL_ASSERT(eventQueue != nullptr);
3878  if(eventQueue->pushCount < MAX_EVENT_COUNT) {
3879  uint32_t eventIndex = atomics::AtomicAddU32(&eventQueue->pushCount, 1);
3880  FPL_ASSERT(eventIndex < MAX_EVENT_COUNT);
3881  eventQueue->events[eventIndex] = event;
3882  }
3883  }
3884 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
3885 
3886  } // platform
3887 
3888 } // fpl
3889 
3890 // ****************************************************************************
3891 //
3892 // Non-Platform specifics
3893 //
3894 // ****************************************************************************
3895 
3896 // Standard includes
3897 #include <stdarg.h> // va_start, va_end, va_list, va_arg
3898 #include <stdio.h> // fprintf, vfprintf, vsnprintf, getchar
3899 
3900 //
3901 // Macros
3902 //
3903 #define FPL_CLEARMEM(T, memory, size, shift, mask) \
3904  do { \
3905  size_t clearedBytes = 0; \
3906  if (sizeof(T) > sizeof(uint8_t)) { \
3907  T *dataBlock = static_cast<T *>(memory); \
3908  T *dataBlockEnd = static_cast<T *>(memory) + (size >> shift); \
3909  while (dataBlock != dataBlockEnd) { \
3910  *dataBlock++ = 0; \
3911  clearedBytes += sizeof(T); \
3912  } \
3913  } \
3914  uint8_t *data8 = (uint8_t *)memory + clearedBytes; \
3915  uint8_t *data8End = (uint8_t *)memory + size; \
3916  while (data8 != data8End) { \
3917  *data8++ = 0; \
3918  } \
3919  } while (0);
3920 
3921 #define FPL_COPYMEM(T, source, sourceSize, dest, shift, mask) \
3922  do { \
3923  size_t copiedBytes = 0; \
3924  if (sizeof(T) > sizeof(uint8_t)) { \
3925  T *sourceDataBlock = static_cast<T *>(source); \
3926  T *sourceDataBlockEnd = static_cast<T *>(source) + (sourceSize >> shift); \
3927  T *destDataBlock = static_cast<T *>(dest); \
3928  while (sourceDataBlock != sourceDataBlockEnd) { \
3929  *destDataBlock++ = *sourceDataBlock++; \
3930  copiedBytes += sizeof(T); \
3931  } \
3932  } \
3933  uint8_t *sourceData8 = (uint8_t *)source + copiedBytes; \
3934  uint8_t *sourceData8End = (uint8_t *)source + sourceSize; \
3935  uint8_t *destData8 = (uint8_t *)dest + copiedBytes; \
3936  while (sourceData8 != sourceData8End) { \
3937  *destData8++ = *sourceData8++; \
3938  } \
3939  } while (0);
3940 
3941 namespace fpl {
3942  namespace common {
3943  //
3944  // Internal types and functions
3945  //
3946  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH = 1024;
3947 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
3948  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT = 256;
3949 # else
3950  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT = 1;
3951 # endif
3952 
3953  struct ErrorState {
3954  char errors[MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT][MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH];
3955  uint32_t count;
3956  };
3957 
3958  fpl_globalvar ErrorState global__LastErrorState;
3959 
3960 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
3961  fpl_internal_inline void PushError_Formatted(const char *format, va_list &argList) {
3962  ErrorState &state = global__LastErrorState;
3963  FPL_ASSERT(format != nullptr);
3964  char buffer[MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH];
3965  ::vsnprintf(buffer, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(buffer), format, argList);
3966  uint32_t messageLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(buffer);
3967  FPL_ASSERT(state.count < MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT);
3968  size_t errorIndex = state.count;
3969  state.count = (state.count + 1) % MAX_ERRORSTATE_COUNT;
3970  strings::CopyAnsiString(buffer, messageLen, state.errors[errorIndex], MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH);
3971 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE)
3972  console::ConsoleFormatError("FPL Error: %s\n", buffer);
3973 # endif
3974  }
3975 # else
3976  fpl_internal_inline void PushError_Formatted(const char *format, va_list &argList) {
3977  ErrorState &state = global__LastErrorState;
3978  FPL_ASSERT(format != nullptr);
3979  char buffer[MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH];
3980  ::vsnprintf(buffer, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(buffer), format, argList);
3981  uint32_t messageLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(buffer);
3982  state.count = 1;
3983  strings::CopyAnsiString(buffer, messageLen, state.errors[0], MAX_LAST_ERROR_STRING_LENGTH);
3984 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_ERROR_IN_CONSOLE)
3985  console::ConsoleFormatError("FPL Error: %s\n", buffer);
3986 # endif
3987  }
3988 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
3989 
3990 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
3991  struct CommonAudioState {
3992  AudioDeviceFormat internalFormat;
3993  AudioClientReadFunction *clientReadCallback;
3994  void *clientUserData;
3995  };
3996 
3997  fpl_internal_inline uint32_t ReadAudioFramesFromClient(const CommonAudioState &commonAudio, uint32_t frameCount, void *pSamples) {
3998  uint32_t outputSamplesWritten = 0;
3999  if(commonAudio.clientReadCallback != nullptr) {
4000  outputSamplesWritten = commonAudio.clientReadCallback(commonAudio.internalFormat, frameCount, pSamples, commonAudio.clientUserData);
4001  }
4002  return outputSamplesWritten;
4003  }
4004 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
4005 
4006  fpl_internal_inline void PushError(const char *format, ...) {
4007  va_list valist;
4008  va_start(valist, format);
4009  PushError_Formatted(format, valist);
4010  va_end(valist);
4011  }
4012 
4013  // Maximum number of active threads you can have in your process
4014  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_THREAD_COUNT = 64;
4015 
4016  // Maximum number of active signals you can wait for
4017  fpl_constant uint32_t MAX_SIGNAL_COUNT = 256;
4018 
4019  struct ThreadState {
4020  threading::ThreadContext mainThread;
4021  threading::ThreadContext threads[MAX_THREAD_COUNT];
4022  };
4023 
4024  fpl_globalvar ThreadState global__ThreadState = {};
4025 
4026  fpl_internal_inline threading::ThreadContext *GetFreeThreadContext() {
4027  threading::ThreadContext *result = nullptr;
4028  for(uint32_t index = 0; index < MAX_THREAD_COUNT; ++index) {
4029  threading::ThreadContext *thread = global__ThreadState.threads + index;
4030  threading::ThreadState state = threading::GetThreadState(thread);
4031  if(state == threading::ThreadState::Stopped) {
4032  result = thread;
4033  break;
4034  }
4035  }
4036  return(result);
4037  }
4038  } // common
4039 
4040  //
4041  // Common Strings
4042  //
4043  namespace strings {
4044  fpl_common_api bool IsStringEqual(const char *a, const uint32_t aLen, const char *b, const uint32_t bLen) {
4045  if((a == nullptr) || (b == nullptr)) {
4046  return (a == b);
4047  }
4048  if(aLen != bLen) {
4049  return false;
4050  }
4051  FPL_ASSERT(aLen == bLen);
4052  bool result = true;
4053  for(uint32_t index = 0; index < aLen; ++index) {
4054  char aChar = a[index];
4055  char bChar = b[index];
4056  if(aChar != bChar) {
4057  result = false;
4058  break;
4059  }
4060  }
4061  return(result);
4062  }
4063 
4064  fpl_common_api bool IsStringEqual(const char *a, const char *b) {
4065  if((a == nullptr) || (b == nullptr)) {
4066  return (a == b);
4067  }
4068  bool result = true;
4069  for(;;) {
4070  const char aChar = *(a++);
4071  const char bChar = *(b++);
4072  if(aChar == 0 || bChar == 0) {
4073  result = (aChar == bChar);
4074  break;
4075  }
4076  if(aChar != bChar) {
4077  result = false;
4078  break;
4079  }
4080  }
4081  return(result);
4082  }
4083 
4084  fpl_common_api uint32_t GetAnsiStringLength(const char *str) {
4085  uint32_t result = 0;
4086  if(str != nullptr) {
4087  while(*str++) {
4088  result++;
4089  }
4090  }
4091  return(result);
4092  }
4093 
4094  fpl_common_api uint32_t GetWideStringLength(const wchar_t *str) {
4095  uint32_t result = 0;
4096  if(str != nullptr) {
4097  while(*str++) {
4098  result++;
4099  }
4100  }
4101  return(result);
4102  }
4103 
4104  fpl_common_api char *CopyAnsiString(const char *source, const uint32_t sourceLen, char *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4105  char *result = nullptr;
4106  if((source != nullptr && dest != nullptr) && ((sourceLen + 1) <= maxDestLen)) {
4107  result = dest;
4108  uint32_t index = 0;
4109  while(index++ < sourceLen) {
4110  *dest++ = *source++;
4111  }
4112  *dest = 0;
4113  } else {
4114  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4115  }
4116  return(result);
4117  }
4118 
4119  fpl_common_api char *CopyAnsiString(const char *source, char *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4120  char *result = nullptr;
4121  if(source != nullptr) {
4122  uint32_t sourceLen = GetAnsiStringLength(source);
4123  char *result = CopyAnsiString(source, sourceLen, dest, maxDestLen);
4124  } else {
4125  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4126  }
4127  return(result);
4128  }
4129 
4130  fpl_common_api wchar_t *CopyWideString(const wchar_t *source, const uint32_t sourceLen, wchar_t *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4131  wchar_t *result = nullptr;
4132  if((source != nullptr && dest != nullptr) && ((sourceLen + 1) <= maxDestLen)) {
4133  result = dest;
4134  uint32_t index = 0;
4135  while(index++ < sourceLen) {
4136  *dest++ = *source++;
4137  }
4138  *dest = 0;
4139  } else {
4140  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4141  }
4142  return(result);
4143  }
4144 
4145  fpl_common_api wchar_t *CopyWideString(const wchar_t *source, wchar_t *dest, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4146  wchar_t *result = nullptr;
4147  if(source != nullptr) {
4148  uint32_t sourceLen = GetWideStringLength(source);
4149  result = CopyWideString(source, sourceLen, dest, maxDestLen);
4150  } else {
4151  // @TODO(final): Do we want to push a error here?
4152  }
4153  return(result);
4154  }
4155  } // strings
4156 
4157  //
4158  // Common Memory
4159  //
4160  namespace memory {
4161  fpl_common_api void *MemoryAlignedAllocate(const size_t size, const size_t alignment) {
4162  if(size == 0) {
4163  common::PushError("Memory size parameter must be greater than zero");
4164  return nullptr;
4165  }
4166  if((alignment == 0) || (alignment & (alignment - 1))) {
4167  common::PushError("Alignment '%zu' must be greater than zero and a power of two", alignment);
4168  return nullptr;
4169  }
4170 
4171  // Allocate empty memory to hold a size of a pointer + the actual size + alignment padding
4172  size_t newSize = sizeof(void *) + size + (alignment << 1);
4173  void *basePtr = fpl::memory::MemoryAllocate(newSize);
4174 
4175  // The resulting address starts after the stored base pointer
4176  void *alignedPtr = (void *)((uint8_t *)basePtr + sizeof(void *));
4177 
4178  // Move the resulting address to a aligned one when not aligned
4179  uintptr_t mask = alignment - 1;
4180  if((alignment > 1) && (((uintptr_t)alignedPtr & mask) != 0)) {
4181  uintptr_t offset = ((uintptr_t)alignment - ((uintptr_t)alignedPtr & mask));
4182  alignedPtr = (uint8_t *)alignedPtr + offset;
4183  }
4184 
4185  // Write the base pointer before the alignment pointer
4186  *(void **)((void *)((uint8_t *)alignedPtr - sizeof(void *))) = basePtr;
4187 
4188  // Ensure alignment
4189  FPL_ASSERT(FPL_IS_ALIGNED(alignedPtr, alignment));
4190 
4191  return(alignedPtr);
4192  }
4193 
4194  fpl_common_api void MemoryAlignedFree(void *ptr) {
4195  if(ptr == nullptr) {
4196  common::PushError("Memory pointer parameter are not allowed to be null");
4197  return;
4198  }
4199 
4200  // Free the base pointer which is stored to the left from the given pointer
4201  void *basePtr = *(void **)((void *)((uint8_t *)ptr - sizeof(void *)));
4202  FPL_ASSERT(basePtr != nullptr);
4203  MemoryFree(basePtr);
4204  }
4205 
4206  fpl_constant size_t MEM_SHIFT_64 = 3;
4207  fpl_constant size_t MEM_MASK_64 = 0x00000007;
4208  fpl_constant size_t MEM_SHIFT_32 = 2;
4209  fpl_constant size_t MEM_MASK_32 = 0x00000003;
4210  fpl_constant size_t MEM_SHIFT_16 = 1;
4211  fpl_constant size_t MEM_MASK_16 = 0x00000001;
4212 
4213  fpl_common_api void MemoryClear(void *mem, const size_t size) {
4214  if(mem == nullptr) {
4215  common::PushError("Memory parameter are not allowed to be null");
4216  return;
4217  }
4218  if(size == 0) {
4219  common::PushError("Size parameter must be greater than zero");
4220  return;
4221  }
4222  if(size % 8 == 0) {
4223  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint64_t, mem, size, MEM_SHIFT_64, MEM_MASK_64);
4224  } else if(size % 4 == 0) {
4225  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint32_t, mem, size, MEM_SHIFT_32, MEM_MASK_32);
4226  } else if(size % 2 == 0) {
4227  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint16_t, mem, size, MEM_SHIFT_16, MEM_MASK_16);
4228  } else {
4229  FPL_CLEARMEM(uint8_t, mem, size, 0, 0);
4230  }
4231  }
4232 
4233  fpl_common_api void MemoryCopy(void *sourceMem, const size_t sourceSize, void *targetMem) {
4234  if(sourceMem == nullptr) {
4235  common::PushError("Source memory parameter are not allowed to be null");
4236  return;
4237  }
4238  if(sourceSize == 0) {
4239  common::PushError("Source size parameter must be greater than zero");
4240  return;
4241  }
4242  if(targetMem == nullptr) {
4243  common::PushError("Target memory parameter are not allowed to be null");
4244  return;
4245  }
4246  if(sourceSize % 8 == 0) {
4247  FPL_COPYMEM(uint64_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, MEM_SHIFT_64, MEM_MASK_64);
4248  } else if(sourceSize % 4 == 0) {
4249  FPL_COPYMEM(uint32_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, MEM_SHIFT_32, MEM_MASK_32);
4250  } else if(sourceSize % 2 == 0) {
4251  FPL_COPYMEM(uint16_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, MEM_SHIFT_32, MEM_MASK_32);
4252  } else {
4253  FPL_COPYMEM(uint8_t, sourceMem, sourceSize, targetMem, 0, 0);
4254  }
4255  }
4256  } // memory
4257 
4258  //
4259  // Common Atomics
4260  //
4261  namespace atomics {
4262  fpl_common_api void *AtomicExchangePtr(volatile void **target, const void *value) {
4263  FPL_ASSERT(target != nullptr);
4264 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4265  void *result = (void *)AtomicExchangeU64((volatile uint64_t *)target, (uint64_t)value);
4266 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4267  void *result = (void *)AtomicExchangeU32((volatile uint32_t *)target, (uint32_t)value);
4268 # else
4269 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4270 # endif
4271  return (result);
4272  }
4273 
4274  fpl_common_api void *AtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange) {
4275  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
4276 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4277  void *result = (void *)AtomicCompareAndExchangeU64((volatile uint64_t *)dest, (uint64_t)comparand, (uint64_t)exchange);
4278 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4279  void *result = (void *)AtomicCompareAndExchangeU32((volatile uint32_t *)dest, (uint32_t)comparand, (uint32_t)exchange);
4280 # else
4281 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4282 # endif
4283  return (result);
4284  }
4285 
4286  fpl_common_api bool IsAtomicCompareAndExchangePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *comparand, const void *exchange) {
4287  FPL_ASSERT(dest != nullptr);
4288 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4289  bool result = IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU64((volatile uint64_t *)dest, (uint64_t)comparand, (uint64_t)exchange);
4290 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4291  bool result = IsAtomicCompareAndExchangeU32((volatile uint32_t *)dest, (uint32_t)comparand, (uint32_t)exchange);
4292 # else
4293 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4294 # endif // FPL_ARCH
4295  return (result);
4296  }
4297 
4298  fpl_common_api void *AtomicLoadPtr(volatile void **source) {
4299 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4300  void *result = (void *)AtomicLoadU64((volatile uint64_t *)source);
4301 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4302  void *result = (void *)AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)source);
4303 # else
4304 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4305 # endif
4306  return(result);
4307  }
4308 
4309  fpl_common_api void AtomicStorePtr(volatile void **dest, const void *value) {
4310 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4311  AtomicStoreU64((volatile uint64_t *)dest, (uint64_t)value);
4312 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4313  AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)dest, (uint32_t)value);
4314 # else
4315 # error "Unsupported architecture/platform!"
4316 # endif
4317  }
4318  } // atomics
4319 
4320  //
4321  // Common Paths
4322  //
4323  namespace paths {
4324  fpl_common_api char *ExtractFilePath(const char *sourcePath, char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4325  if(sourcePath == nullptr) {
4326  return nullptr;
4327  }
4328  uint32_t sourceLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(sourcePath);
4329  if(sourceLen == 0) {
4330  return nullptr;
4331  }
4332  if(destPath == nullptr) {
4333  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
4334  return nullptr;
4335  }
4336  if(maxDestLen < (sourceLen + 1)) {
4337  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, sourceLen + 1);
4338  return nullptr;
4339  }
4340 
4341  char *result = nullptr;
4342  if(sourcePath) {
4343  int copyLen = 0;
4344  char *chPtr = (char *)sourcePath;
4345  while(*chPtr) {
4346  if(*chPtr == platform::PATH_SEPARATOR) {
4347  copyLen = (int)(chPtr - sourcePath);
4348  }
4349  ++chPtr;
4350  }
4351  if(copyLen) {
4352  result = strings::CopyAnsiString(sourcePath, copyLen, destPath, maxDestLen);
4353  }
4354  }
4355  return(result);
4356  }
4357 
4358  fpl_common_api char *ExtractFileExtension(const char *sourcePath) {
4359  char *result = (char *)nullptr;
4360  if(sourcePath != nullptr) {
4361  char *filename = ExtractFileName(sourcePath);
4362  if(filename) {
4363  char *chPtr = filename;
4364  char *firstSeparatorPtr = (char *)nullptr;
4365  while(*chPtr) {
4366  if(*chPtr == platform::FILE_EXT_SEPARATOR) {
4367  firstSeparatorPtr = chPtr;
4368  break;
4369  }
4370  ++chPtr;
4371  }
4372  if(firstSeparatorPtr != nullptr) {
4373  result = firstSeparatorPtr;
4374  }
4375  }
4376  }
4377  return(result);
4378  }
4379 
4380  fpl_common_api char *ExtractFileName(const char *sourcePath) {
4381  char *result = (char *)nullptr;
4382  if(sourcePath) {
4383  result = (char *)sourcePath;
4384  char *chPtr = (char *)sourcePath;
4385  char *lastPtr = (char *)nullptr;
4386  while(*chPtr) {
4387  if(*chPtr == platform::PATH_SEPARATOR) {
4388  lastPtr = chPtr;
4389  }
4390  ++chPtr;
4391  }
4392  if(lastPtr != nullptr) {
4393  result = lastPtr + 1;
4394  }
4395  }
4396  return(result);
4397  }
4398 
4399  fpl_common_api char *ChangeFileExtension(const char *filePath, const char *newFileExtension, char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
4400  if(filePath == nullptr) {
4401  return nullptr;
4402  }
4403  if(newFileExtension == nullptr) {
4404  return nullptr;
4405  }
4406  uint32_t pathLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(filePath);
4407  if(pathLen == 0) {
4408  return nullptr;
4409  }
4410  uint32_t extLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(newFileExtension);
4411 
4412  if(destPath == nullptr) {
4413  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
4414  return nullptr;
4415  }
4416  if(maxDestLen < (pathLen + extLen + 1)) {
4417  common::PushError("Max dest len parameter '%d' must be greater or equal than '%d'", maxDestLen, pathLen + extLen + 1);
4418  return nullptr;
4419  }
4420 
4421  char *result = nullptr;
4422  if(filePath != nullptr) {
4423  // Find last path
4424  char *chPtr = (char *)filePath;
4425  char *lastPathSeparatorPtr = nullptr;
4426  while(*chPtr) {
4427  if(*chPtr == platform::PATH_SEPARATOR) {
4428  lastPathSeparatorPtr = chPtr;
4429  }
4430  ++chPtr;
4431  }
4432 
4433  // Find last ext separator
4434  if(lastPathSeparatorPtr != nullptr) {
4435  chPtr = lastPathSeparatorPtr + 1;
4436  } else {
4437  chPtr = (char *)filePath;
4438  }
4439  char *lastExtSeparatorPtr = nullptr;
4440  while(*chPtr) {
4441  if(*chPtr == platform::FILE_EXT_SEPARATOR) {
4442  lastExtSeparatorPtr = chPtr;
4443  }
4444  ++chPtr;
4445  }
4446 
4447  uint32_t copyLen;
4448  if(lastExtSeparatorPtr != nullptr) {
4449  copyLen = (uint32_t)((uintptr_t)lastExtSeparatorPtr - (uintptr_t)filePath);
4450  } else {
4451  copyLen = pathLen;
4452  }
4453 
4454  // Copy parts
4455  strings::CopyAnsiString(filePath, copyLen, destPath, maxDestLen);
4456  char *destExtPtr = destPath + copyLen;
4457  strings::CopyAnsiString(newFileExtension, extLen, destExtPtr, maxDestLen - copyLen);
4458  result = destPath;
4459  }
4460  return(result);
4461  }
4462 
4463  fpl_common_api char *CombinePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestPathLen, const uint32_t pathCount, ...) {
4464  if(pathCount == 0) {
4465  return nullptr;
4466  }
4467  if(destPath == nullptr) {
4468  common::PushError("Dest path parameter are not allowed to be null");
4469  return nullptr;
4470  }
4471  if(maxDestPathLen == 0) {
4472  common::PushError("Max dest path len parameter must be greater than zero");
4473  return nullptr;
4474  }
4475 
4476  uint32_t curDestPosition = 0;
4477  char *currentDestPtr = destPath;
4478  va_list vargs;
4479  va_start(vargs, pathCount);
4480  for(uint32_t pathIndex = 0; pathIndex < pathCount; ++pathIndex) {
4481  char *path = va_arg(vargs, char *);
4482  uint32_t pathLen = strings::GetAnsiStringLength(path);
4483  bool requireSeparator = pathIndex < (pathCount - 1);
4484  uint32_t requiredPathLen = requireSeparator ? pathLen + 1 : pathLen;
4485  FPL_ASSERT(curDestPosition + requiredPathLen <= maxDestPathLen);
4486  strings::CopyAnsiString(path, pathLen, currentDestPtr, maxDestPathLen - curDestPosition);
4487  currentDestPtr += pathLen;
4488  if(requireSeparator) {
4489  *currentDestPtr++ = platform::PATH_SEPARATOR;
4490  }
4491  curDestPosition += requiredPathLen;
4492  }
4493  *currentDestPtr = 0;
4494  va_end(vargs);
4495  return destPath;
4496  }
4497 
4498  } // paths
4499 
4500 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
4501  namespace window {
4502  fpl_common_api bool PollWindowEvent(Event &ev) {
4503  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__EventQueue != nullptr);
4504  platform::EventQueue *eventQueue = platform::global__EventQueue;
4505  bool result = false;
4506  if(eventQueue->pushCount > 0 && (eventQueue->pollIndex < eventQueue->pushCount)) {
4507  uint32_t eventIndex = atomics::AtomicAddU32(&eventQueue->pollIndex, 1);
4508  ev = eventQueue->events[eventIndex];
4509  result = true;
4510  } else if(eventQueue->pushCount > 0) {
4511  atomics::AtomicExchangeU32(&eventQueue->pollIndex, 0);
4512  atomics::AtomicExchangeU32(&eventQueue->pushCount, 0);
4513  }
4514  return result;
4515  }
4516 
4517  fpl_common_api void ClearWindowEvents() {
4518  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__EventQueue != nullptr);
4519  platform::EventQueue *eventQueue = platform::global__EventQueue;
4520  atomics::AtomicExchangeU32(&eventQueue->pollIndex, 0);
4521  atomics::AtomicExchangeU32(&eventQueue->pushCount, 0);
4522  }
4523  } // window
4524 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
4525 
4526 
4527 } // fpl
4528 
4529 // ****************************************************************************
4530 //
4531 // WIN32 Platform
4532 //
4533 // ****************************************************************************
4534 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
4535 
4536 # if defined(FPL_ARCH_X86)
4537 # define FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER() \
4538  LONG barrier; \
4539  ::_InterlockedOr(&barrier, 0);
4540 # elif defined(FPL_ARCH_X64)
4541  // @NOTE(final): No need for hardware memory fence on X64 because the hardware guarantees memory order always.
4542 # define FPL_MEMORY_BARRIER()
4543 # endif
4544 
4545  // @NOTE(final): Little macro to not write 5 lines of code all the time
4546 # define FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(libHandle, libName, target, type, name) \
4547  target = (type *)::GetProcAddress(libHandle, name); \
4548  if (target == nullptr) { \
4549  fpl::common::PushError("Failed getting '%s' from library '%s'", name, libName); \
4550  return false; \
4551  }
4552 
4553 namespace fpl {
4554  namespace platform {
4555 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
4556  struct Win32WindowStyle {
4557  DWORD style;
4558  DWORD exStyle;
4559  };
4560 
4561  fpl_constant DWORD Win32ResizeableWindowStyle = WS_THICKFRAME | WS_SYSMENU | WS_MINIMIZEBOX | WS_MAXIMIZEBOX | WS_VISIBLE;
4562  fpl_constant DWORD Win32ResizeableWindowExtendedStyle = WS_EX_LEFT;
4563 
4564  fpl_constant DWORD Win32NonResizableWindowStyle = WS_CAPTION | WS_SYSMENU | WS_MINIMIZEBOX | WS_VISIBLE;
4565  fpl_constant DWORD Win32NonResizableWindowExtendedStyle = WS_EX_LEFT;
4566 
4567  fpl_constant DWORD Win32FullscreenWindowStyle = WS_POPUP | WS_VISIBLE;
4568  fpl_constant DWORD Win32FullscreenWindowExtendedStyle = WS_EX_APPWINDOW | WS_EX_TOPMOST;
4569 
4570  fpl_internal bool Win32LeaveFullscreen() {
4571  // @TODO(final): The old window rect may be wrong when the display was changed (Turn off, Orientation, Grid Position, Screen res).
4572  FPL_ASSERT(global__AppState != nullptr);
4573  const PlatformAppState *platState = global__AppState;
4574  const Win32AppState &win32State = platState->win32;
4575  const Win32APIFunctions &wapi = win32State.winApi;
4576  const WindowSettings &settings = platState->currentSettings.window;
4577  const Win32WindowState &win32Window = platState->window.win32;
4578  const Win32LastWindowInfo &fullscreenInfo = win32Window.lastFullscreenInfo;
4579 
4580  HWND windowHandle = win32Window.windowHandle;
4581 
4582  FPL_ASSERT(fullscreenInfo.style > 0 && fullscreenInfo.exStyle > 0);
4583  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_STYLE, fullscreenInfo.style);
4584  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_EXSTYLE, fullscreenInfo.exStyle);
4585  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &fullscreenInfo.placement);
4586  wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
4587 
4588  if(fullscreenInfo.isMaximized) {
4589  win32_sendMessage(windowHandle, WM_SYSCOMMAND, SC_MAXIMIZE, 0);
4590  }
4591 
4592  bool result;
4593  if(fullscreenInfo.wasResolutionChanged) {
4594  result = (wapi.user.changeDisplaySettingsA(nullptr, CDS_RESET) == DISP_CHANGE_SUCCESSFUL);
4595  } else {
4596  result = true;
4597  }
4598 
4599  return(result);
4600  }
4601 
4602  fpl_internal bool Win32EnterFullscreen(const uint32_t fullscreenWidth, const uint32_t fullscreenHeight, const uint32_t refreshRate, const uint32_t colorBits) {
4603  FPL_ASSERT(global__AppState != nullptr);
4604  PlatformAppState *platState = global__AppState;
4605  Win32AppState &win32State = platState->win32;
4606  const Win32APIFunctions &wapi = win32State.winApi;
4607  const WindowSettings &settings = platState->currentSettings.window;
4608  Win32WindowState &win32Window = platState->window.win32;
4609  Win32LastWindowInfo &fullscreenInfo = win32Window.lastFullscreenInfo;
4610 
4611  HWND windowHandle = win32Window.windowHandle;
4612  HDC deviceContext = win32Window.deviceContext;
4613 
4614  FPL_ASSERT(fullscreenInfo.style > 0 && fullscreenInfo.exStyle > 0);
4615  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_STYLE, fullscreenInfo.style & ~(WS_CAPTION | WS_THICKFRAME));
4616  win32_setWindowLong(windowHandle, GWL_EXSTYLE, fullscreenInfo.exStyle & ~(WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME | WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE | WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE | WS_EX_STATICEDGE));
4617 
4618  MONITORINFO monitor = {};
4619  monitor.cbSize = sizeof(monitor);
4620  win32_getMonitorInfo(wapi.user.monitorFromWindow(windowHandle, MONITOR_DEFAULTTONEAREST), &monitor);
4621 
4622  bool result;
4623  if(fullscreenWidth > 0 && fullscreenHeight > 0) {
4624  DWORD useFullscreenWidth = fullscreenWidth;
4625  DWORD useFullscreenHeight = fullscreenHeight;
4626 
4627  DWORD useRefreshRate = refreshRate;
4628  if(!useRefreshRate) {
4629  useRefreshRate = wapi.gdi.getDeviceCaps(deviceContext, VREFRESH);
4630  }
4631 
4632  DWORD useColourBits = colorBits;
4633  if(!useColourBits) {
4634  useColourBits = wapi.gdi.getDeviceCaps(deviceContext, BITSPIXEL);
4635  }
4636 
4637  // @TODO(final): Is this correct to assume the fullscreen rect is at (0, 0, w - 1, h - 1)?
4638  RECT windowRect;
4639  windowRect.left = 0;
4640  windowRect.top = 0;
4641  windowRect.right = windowRect.left + (useFullscreenWidth - 1);
4642  windowRect.bottom = windowRect.left + (useFullscreenHeight - 1);
4643 
4644  WINDOWPLACEMENT placement = {};
4645  placement.length = sizeof(placement);
4646  placement.rcNormalPosition = windowRect;
4647  placement.showCmd = SW_SHOW;
4648  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &placement);
4649  wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
4650 
4651  DEVMODEA fullscreenSettings = {};
4652  wapi.user.enumDisplaySettingsA(nullptr, 0, &fullscreenSettings);
4653  fullscreenSettings.dmPelsWidth = useFullscreenWidth;
4654  fullscreenSettings.dmPelsHeight = useFullscreenHeight;
4655  fullscreenSettings.dmBitsPerPel = useColourBits;
4656  fullscreenSettings.dmDisplayFrequency = useRefreshRate;
4657  fullscreenSettings.dmFields = DM_PELSWIDTH | DM_PELSHEIGHT | DM_BITSPERPEL | DM_DISPLAYFREQUENCY;
4658  result = (wapi.user.changeDisplaySettingsA(&fullscreenSettings, CDS_FULLSCREEN) == DISP_CHANGE_SUCCESSFUL);
4659  fullscreenInfo.wasResolutionChanged = true;
4660  } else {
4661  RECT windowRect = monitor.rcMonitor;
4662 
4663  WINDOWPLACEMENT placement = {};
4664  placement.length = sizeof(placement);
4665  placement.rcNormalPosition = windowRect;
4666  placement.showCmd = SW_SHOW;
4667  wapi.user.setWindowPlacement(windowHandle, &placement);
4668  wapi.user.setWindowPos(windowHandle, nullptr, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_NOZORDER | SWP_NOACTIVATE | SWP_FRAMECHANGED);
4669 
4670  result = true;
4671  fullscreenInfo.wasResolutionChanged = false;
4672  }
4673 
4674  return(result);
4675  }
4676 
4677  fpl_internal_inline float Win32XInputProcessStickValue(const SHORT value, const SHORT deadZoneThreshold) {
4678  float result = 0;
4679  if(value < -deadZoneThreshold) {
4680  result = (float)((value + deadZoneThreshold) / (32768.0f - deadZoneThreshold));
4681  } else if(value > deadZoneThreshold) {
4682  result = (float)((value - deadZoneThreshold) / (32767.0f - deadZoneThreshold));
4683  }
4684  return(result);
4685  }
4686 
4687  fpl_internal void Win32PollControllers(const Settings &settings, const Win32InitState &initState, Win32XInputState &xinputState) {
4688  using namespace window;
4689  if(xinputState.xinputApi.xInputGetState != nullptr) {
4690  //
4691  // Detect new controller (Only on a fixed frequency)
4692  //
4693  if(xinputState.lastDeviceSearchTime.QuadPart == 0) {
4694  ::QueryPerformanceCounter(&xinputState.lastDeviceSearchTime);
4695  }
4696  LARGE_INTEGER currentDeviceSearchTime;
4697  ::QueryPerformanceCounter(&currentDeviceSearchTime);
4698  uint64_t deviceSearchDifferenceTimeInMs = ((currentDeviceSearchTime.QuadPart - xinputState.lastDeviceSearchTime.QuadPart) / (initState.performanceFrequency.QuadPart / 1000));
4699  if((settings.input.controllerDetectionFrequency == 0) || (deviceSearchDifferenceTimeInMs > settings.input.controllerDetectionFrequency)) {
4700  xinputState.lastDeviceSearchTime = currentDeviceSearchTime;
4701  for(DWORD controllerIndex = 0; controllerIndex < XUSER_MAX_COUNT; ++controllerIndex) {
4702  XINPUT_STATE controllerState = {};
4703  if(xinputState.xinputApi.xInputGetState(controllerIndex, &controllerState) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
4704  if(!xinputState.isConnected[controllerIndex]) {
4705  // Connected
4706  xinputState.isConnected[controllerIndex] = true;
4707  Event ev = {};
4708  ev.type = EventType::Gamepad;
4709  ev.gamepad.type = GamepadEventType::Connected;
4710  ev.gamepad.deviceIndex = controllerIndex;
4711  PushEvent(ev);
4712  }
4713  } else {
4714  if(xinputState.isConnected[controllerIndex]) {
4715  // Disonnected
4716  xinputState.isConnected[controllerIndex] = false;
4717  Event ev = {};
4718  ev.type = EventType::Gamepad;
4719  ev.gamepad.type = GamepadEventType::Disconnected;
4720  ev.gamepad.deviceIndex = controllerIndex;
4721  PushEvent(ev);
4722  }
4723  }
4724  }
4725  }
4726 
4727  //
4728  // Update controller state when connected only
4729  //
4730  for(DWORD controllerIndex = 0; controllerIndex < XUSER_MAX_COUNT; ++controllerIndex) {
4731  if(xinputState.isConnected[controllerIndex]) {
4732  XINPUT_STATE controllerState = {};
4733  if(xinputState.xinputApi.xInputGetState(controllerIndex, &controllerState) == ERROR_SUCCESS) {
4734  // State changed
4735  Event ev = {};
4736  ev.type = EventType::Gamepad;
4737  ev.gamepad.type = GamepadEventType::StateChanged;
4738  ev.gamepad.deviceIndex = controllerIndex;
4739 
4740  XINPUT_GAMEPAD *pad = &controllerState.Gamepad;
4741 
4742  // Analog sticks
4743  ev.gamepad.state.leftStickX = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbLX, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_LEFT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
4744  ev.gamepad.state.leftStickY = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbLY, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_LEFT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
4745  ev.gamepad.state.rightStickX = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbRX, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_RIGHT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
4746  ev.gamepad.state.rightStickY = Win32XInputProcessStickValue(pad->sThumbRY, XINPUT_GAMEPAD_RIGHT_THUMB_DEADZONE);
4747 
4748  // Triggers
4749  ev.gamepad.state.leftTrigger = (float)pad->bLeftTrigger / 255.0f;
4750  ev.gamepad.state.rightTrigger = (float)pad->bRightTrigger / 255.0f;
4751 
4752  // Digital pad buttons
4753  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_UP)
4754  ev.gamepad.state.dpadUp = { true };
4755  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_DOWN)
4756  ev.gamepad.state.dpadDown = { true };
4757  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_LEFT)
4758  ev.gamepad.state.dpadLeft = { true };
4759  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_DPAD_RIGHT)
4760  ev.gamepad.state.dpadRight = { true };
4761 
4762  // Action buttons
4763  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_A)
4764  ev.gamepad.state.actionA = { true };
4765  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_B)
4766  ev.gamepad.state.actionB = { true };
4767  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_X)
4768  ev.gamepad.state.actionX = { true };
4769  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_Y)
4770  ev.gamepad.state.actionY = { true };
4771 
4772  // Center buttons
4773  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_START)
4774  ev.gamepad.state.start = { true };
4775  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_BACK)
4776  ev.gamepad.state.back = { true };
4777 
4778  // Shoulder buttons
4779  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_LEFT_SHOULDER)
4780  ev.gamepad.state.leftShoulder = { true };
4781  if(pad->wButtons & XINPUT_GAMEPAD_RIGHT_SHOULDER)
4782  ev.gamepad.state.rightShoulder = { true };
4783 
4784  PushEvent(ev);
4785  }
4786  }
4787  }
4788  }
4789  }
4790 
4791  fpl_internal_inline void Win32PushMouseEvent(const window::MouseEventType &mouseEventType, const window::MouseButtonType mouseButton, const LPARAM lParam, const WPARAM wParam) {
4792  using namespace window;
4793  Event newEvent = {};
4794  newEvent.type = EventType::Mouse;
4795  newEvent.mouse.type = mouseEventType;
4796  newEvent.mouse.mouseX = GET_X_LPARAM(lParam);
4797  newEvent.mouse.mouseY = GET_Y_LPARAM(lParam);
4798  newEvent.mouse.mouseButton = mouseButton;
4799  if(mouseEventType == MouseEventType::Wheel) {
4800  short zDelta = GET_WHEEL_DELTA_WPARAM(wParam);
4801  newEvent.mouse.wheelDelta = (zDelta / (float)WHEEL_DELTA);
4802  }
4803  PushEvent(newEvent);
4804  }
4805 
4806  fpl_internal window::Key Win32MapVirtualKey(const uint64_t keyCode) {
4807  using namespace window;
4808  switch(keyCode) {
4809  case VK_BACK:
4810  return Key::Key_Backspace;
4811  case VK_TAB:
4812  return Key::Key_Tab;
4813 
4814  case VK_CLEAR:
4815  return Key::Key_Clear;
4816  case VK_RETURN:
4817  return Key::Key_Enter;
4818 
4819  case VK_SHIFT:
4820  return Key::Key_Shift;
