8360 // ****************************************************************************
8361 //
8362 // Linux Platform
8363 //
8364 // ****************************************************************************
8365 #if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX)
8366 # include <ctype.h> // isspace
8367 
8368 namespace fpl {
8369  namespace platform {
8370  fpl_internal void LinuxReleasePlatform(PlatformInitState &initState, PlatformAppState *appState) {
8371  LinuxAppState &linuxAppState = appState->linux;
8372  platform::POSIXReleasePlatform(linuxAppState.posix);
8373  }
8374 
8375  fpl_internal bool LinuxInitPlatform(const InitFlags initFlags, const Settings &initSettings, PlatformInitState &initState, PlatformAppState *appState) {
8376  LinuxInitState &linuxInitState = initState.linux;
8377  LinuxAppState &linuxAppState = appState->linux;
8378  if(!platform::POSIXInitPlatform(initFlags, initSettings, linuxInitState.posix, linuxAppState.posix)) {
8379  common::PushError("Failed initalizing POSIX platform");
8380  return false;
8381  }
8382  return true;
8383  }
8384  }
8385 
8386  // Linux Hardware
8387  namespace hardware {
8388  fpl_platform_api uint32_t GetProcessorCoreCount() {
8389  uint32_t result = sysconf(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
8390  return(result);
8391  }
8392 
8393  fpl_platform_api char *GetProcessorName(char *destBuffer, const uint32_t maxDestBufferLen) {
8394  if(destBuffer == nullptr) {
8395  common::PushError("Dest buffer parameter are not allowed to be null");
8396  return nullptr;
8397  }
8398  if(maxDestBufferLen == 0) {
8399  common::PushError("Max dest buffer len parameter '%d' must be greater than zero");
8400  return nullptr;
8401  }
8402  char *result = nullptr;
8403  FILE *fileHandle = fopen("/proc/cpuinfo", "rb");
8404  if(fileHandle != nullptr) {
8405  char buffer[256];
8406  char line[256];
8407  const size_t maxBufferSize = FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(buffer);
8408  int32_t readSize = maxBufferSize;
8409  int32_t readPos = 0;
8410  bool found = false;
8411  int bytesRead = 0;
8412  while((bytesRead = fread(&buffer[readPos], readSize, 1, fileHandle)) > 0) {
8413  char *lastP = &buffer[0];
8414  char *p = &buffer[0];
8415  while(*p) {
8416  if(*p == '\n') {
8417  int32_t len = p - lastP;
8418  FPL_ASSERT(len > 0);
8419  if(strings::IsStringEqual(lastP, 10, "model name", 10)) {
8420  strings::CopyAnsiString(lastP, len, line, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(line));
8421  found = true;
8422  break;
8423  }
8424  lastP = p + 1;
8425  }
8426  ++p;
8427  }
8428  if(found) {
8429  break;
8430  }
8431 
8432  int32_t remaining = &buffer[maxBufferSize] - lastP;
8433  FPL_ASSERT(remaining >= 0);
8434  if(remaining > 0) {
8435  // Buffer does not contain a line separator - copy back to remaining characters to the line
8436  strings::CopyAnsiString(lastP, remaining, line, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(line));
8437  // Copy back line to buffer and use a different read position/size
8438  strings::CopyAnsiString(line, remaining, buffer, maxBufferSize);
8439  readPos = remaining;
8440  readSize = maxBufferSize - remaining;
8441  } else {
8442  readPos = 0;
8443  readSize = maxBufferSize;
8444  }
8445  }
8446  if(found) {
8447  char *p = line;
8448  while(*p) {
8449  if(*p == ':') {
8450  ++p;
8451  // Skip whitespaces
8452  while(*p && isspace(*p)) {
8453  ++p;
8454  }
8455  break;
8456  }
8457  ++p;
8458  }
8459  if(p != line) {
8460  strings::CopyAnsiString(p, destBuffer, maxDestBufferLen);
8461  result = destBuffer;
8462  }
8463  }
8464  fclose(fileHandle);
8465  }
8466  return(result);
8467  }
8468 
8469  fpl_platform_api MemoryInfos GetSystemMemoryInfos() {
8470  MemoryInfos result = {};
8471  return(result);
8472  }
8473  } // hardware
8474 
8475  namespace paths {
8476  fpl_platform_api char *GetExecutableFilePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
8477  return nullptr;
8478  }
8479 
8480  fpl_platform_api char *GetHomePath(char *destPath, const uint32_t maxDestLen) {
8481  return nullptr;
8482  }
8483  } // paths
8484 } // fpl
8485 #endif // FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX
8486 
8487 // ****************************************************************************
8488 //
8489 // Video Drivers
8490 //
8491 // ****************************************************************************
8492 namespace fpl {
8493  namespace drivers {
8494 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
8495 
8496 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
8497  //
8498  // OpenGL Constants and Function-Prototypes
8499  //
8500 # define FPL_GL_CONTEXT_FLAG_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE_BIT 0x0001
8501 # define FPL_GL_CONTEXT_FLAG_DEBUG_BIT 0x00000002
8502 # define FPL_GL_CONTEXT_FLAG_ROBUST_ACCESS_BIT 0x00000004
8503 # define FPL_GL_CONTEXT_FLAG_NO_ERROR_BIT 0x00000008
8504 # define FPL_GL_CONTEXT_CORE_PROFILE_BIT 0x00000001
8505 # define FPL_GL_CONTEXT_COMPATIBILITY_PROFILE_BIT 0x00000002
8506 
8507 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_DEBUG_BIT_ARB 0x0001
8508 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE_BIT_ARB 0x0002
8509 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_CORE_PROFILE_BIT_ARB 0x00000001
8510 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_COMPATIBILITY_PROFILE_BIT_ARB 0x00000002
8511 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK_ARB 0x9126
8512 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_MAJOR_VERSION_ARB 0x2091
8513 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_MINOR_VERSION_ARB 0x2092
8514 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_LAYER_PLANE_ARB 0x2093
8515 # define FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_FLAGS_ARB 0x2094
8516 
8517 # define FPL_WGL_DRAW_TO_WINDOW_ARB 0x2001
8518 # define FPL_WGL_ACCELERATION_ARB 0x2003
8519 # define FPL_WGL_SWAP_METHOD_ARB 0x2007
8520 # define FPL_WGL_SUPPORT_OPENGL_ARB 0x2010
8521 # define FPL_WGL_DOUBLE_BUFFER_ARB 0x2011
8522 # define FPL_WGL_PIXEL_TYPE_ARB 0x2013
8523 # define FPL_WGL_COLOR_BITS_ARB 0x2014
8524 # define FPL_WGL_DEPTH_BITS_ARB 0x2022
8525 # define FPL_WGL_STENCIL_BITS_ARB 0x2023
8526 # define FPL_WGL_FULL_ACCELERATION_ARB 0x2027
8527 # define FPL_WGL_SWAP_EXCHANGE_ARB 0x2028
8528 # define FPL_WGL_TYPE_RGBA_ARB 0x202B
8529 
8530 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_MAKE_CURRENT(name) BOOL WINAPI name(HDC deviceContext, HGLRC renderingContext)
8531  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_MAKE_CURRENT(win32_func_wglMakeCurrent);
8532 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_GET_PROC_ADDRESS(name) PROC WINAPI name(LPCSTR procedure)
8533  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_GET_PROC_ADDRESS(win32_func_wglGetProcAddress);
8534 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_DELETE_CONTEXT(name) BOOL WINAPI name(HGLRC renderingContext)
8535  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_DELETE_CONTEXT(win32_func_wglDeleteContext);
8536 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_CREATE_CONTEXT(name) HGLRC WINAPI name(HDC deviceContext)
8537  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_CREATE_CONTEXT(win32_func_wglCreateContext);
8538 
8539 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_CHOOSE_PIXEL_FORMAT_ARB(name) BOOL WINAPI name(HDC hdc, const int *piAttribIList, const FLOAT *pfAttribFList, UINT nMaxFormats, int *piFormats, UINT *nNumFormats)
8540  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_CHOOSE_PIXEL_FORMAT_ARB(win32_func_wglChoosePixelFormatARB);
8541 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_CREATE_CONTEXT_ATTRIBS_ARB(name) HGLRC WINAPI name(HDC hDC, HGLRC hShareContext, const int *attribList)
8542  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_CREATE_CONTEXT_ATTRIBS_ARB(win32_func_wglCreateContextAttribsARB);
8543 # define FPL_FUNC_WGL_SWAP_INTERVAL_EXT(name) BOOL WINAPI name(int interval)
8544  typedef FPL_FUNC_WGL_SWAP_INTERVAL_EXT(win32_func_wglSwapIntervalEXT);
8545 
8546  struct Win32OpenGLFunctions {
8547  HMODULE openglLibrary;
8548  win32_func_wglMakeCurrent *wglMakeCurrent;
8549  win32_func_wglGetProcAddress *wglGetProcAddress;
8550  win32_func_wglDeleteContext *wglDeleteContext;
8551  win32_func_wglCreateContext *wglCreateContext;
8552  win32_func_wglChoosePixelFormatARB *wglChoosePixelFormatArb;
8553  win32_func_wglCreateContextAttribsARB *wglCreateContextAttribsArb;
8554  win32_func_wglSwapIntervalEXT *wglSwapIntervalExt;
8555  };
8556 
8557  struct Win32VideoOpenGLState {
8558  HGLRC renderingContext;
8559  Win32OpenGLFunctions glApi;
8560  };
8561 
8562  fpl_internal bool Win32PrepareWindowForOpenGL(platform::Win32AppState &appState, const platform::Win32WindowState &windowState, const VideoSettings &videoSettings) {
8563  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = appState.winApi;
8564 
8565  //
8566  // Prepare window for OpenGL
8567  //
8568  HDC deviceContext = windowState.deviceContext;
8569  HWND handle = windowState.windowHandle;
8570 
8571  PIXELFORMATDESCRIPTOR pfd = {};
8572  pfd.nSize = sizeof(pfd);
8573  pfd.nVersion = 1;
8574  pfd.dwFlags = PFD_DOUBLEBUFFER | PFD_SUPPORT_OPENGL | PFD_DRAW_TO_WINDOW;
8575  pfd.iPixelType = PFD_TYPE_RGBA;
8576  pfd.cColorBits = 32;
8577  pfd.cDepthBits = 24;
8578  pfd.cAlphaBits = 8;
8579  pfd.iLayerType = PFD_MAIN_PLANE;
8580 
8581  int pixelFormat = wapi.gdi.choosePixelFormat(deviceContext, &pfd);
8582  if(!pixelFormat) {
8583  common::PushError("Failed choosing RGBA Legacy Pixelformat for Color/Depth/Alpha (%d,%d,%d) and DC '%x'", pfd.cColorBits, pfd.cDepthBits, pfd.cAlphaBits, deviceContext);
8584  return false;
8585  }
8586 
8587  if(!wapi.gdi.setPixelFormat(deviceContext, pixelFormat, &pfd)) {
8588  common::PushError("Failed setting RGBA Pixelformat '%d' for Color/Depth/Alpha (%d,%d,%d and DC '%x')", pixelFormat, pfd.cColorBits, pfd.cDepthBits, pfd.cAlphaBits, deviceContext);
8589  return false;
8590  }
8591 
8592  wapi.gdi.describePixelFormat(deviceContext, pixelFormat, sizeof(pfd), &pfd);
8593 
8594  return true;
8595  }
8596 
8597  fpl_internal bool Win32InitVideoOpenGL(const platform::Win32AppState &appState, const platform::Win32WindowState &windowState, const VideoSettings &videoSettings, Win32VideoOpenGLState &glState) {
8598  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = appState.winApi;
8599  Win32OpenGLFunctions &glFuncs = glState.glApi;
8600 
8601  //
8602  // Load OpenGL Library
8603  //
8604  {
8605  const char *openglLibraryName = "opengl32.dll";
8606  glFuncs.openglLibrary = ::LoadLibraryA("opengl32.dll");
8607  if(glFuncs.openglLibrary == nullptr) {
8608  common::PushError("Failed loading opengl library '%s'", openglLibraryName);
8609  return false;
8610  }
8611 
8612  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress, win32_func_wglGetProcAddress, "wglGetProcAddress");
8613  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglCreateContext, win32_func_wglCreateContext, "wglCreateContext");
8614  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglDeleteContext, win32_func_wglDeleteContext, "wglDeleteContext");
8615  FPL_WIN32_GET_FUNCTION_ADDRESS(glFuncs.openglLibrary, openglLibraryName, glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent, win32_func_wglMakeCurrent, "wglMakeCurrent");
8616  }
8617 
8618  //
8619  // Create opengl rendering context
8620  //
8621  HDC deviceContext = windowState.deviceContext;
8622  HGLRC legacyRenderingContext = glFuncs.wglCreateContext(deviceContext);
8623  if(!legacyRenderingContext) {
8624  common::PushError("Failed creating Legacy OpenGL Rendering Context for DC '%x')", deviceContext);
8625  return false;
8626  }
8627 
8628  if(!glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext)) {
8629  common::PushError("Failed activating Legacy OpenGL Rendering Context for DC '%x' and RC '%x')", deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
8630  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(legacyRenderingContext);
8631  return false;
8632  }
8633 
8634  // Load WGL Extensions
8635  glFuncs.wglSwapIntervalExt = (win32_func_wglSwapIntervalEXT *)glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress("wglSwapIntervalEXT");
8636  glFuncs.wglChoosePixelFormatArb = (win32_func_wglChoosePixelFormatARB *)glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress("wglChoosePixelFormatARB");
8637  glFuncs.wglCreateContextAttribsArb = (win32_func_wglCreateContextAttribsARB *)glFuncs.wglGetProcAddress("wglCreateContextAttribsARB");
8638 
8639  // Disable legacy context
8640  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(nullptr, nullptr);
8641 
8642  HGLRC activeRenderingContext;
8643  if(videoSettings.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags != OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Legacy) {
8644  // @NOTE(final): This is only available in OpenGL 3.0+
8645  if(!(videoSettings.graphics.opengl.majorVersion >= 3 && videoSettings.graphics.opengl.minorVersion >= 0)) {
8646  common::PushError("You have not specified the 'majorVersion' and 'minorVersion' in the VideoSettings");
8647  return false;
8648  }
8649 
8650  if(glFuncs.wglChoosePixelFormatArb == nullptr) {
8651  common::PushError("wglChoosePixelFormatARB is not available, modern OpenGL is not available for your video card");
8652  return false;
8653  }
8654  if(glFuncs.wglCreateContextAttribsArb == nullptr) {
8655  common::PushError("wglCreateContextAttribsARB is not available, modern OpenGL is not available for your video card");
8656  return false;
8657  }
8658 
8659  int profile = 0;
8660  int flags = 0;
8661  if(videoSettings.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags & OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Core) {
8662  profile = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_CORE_PROFILE_BIT_ARB;
8663  } else if(videoSettings.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags & OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Compability) {
8664  profile = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_COMPATIBILITY_PROFILE_BIT_ARB;
8665  } else {
8666  common::PushError("No opengl compability profile selected, please specific Core OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Core or OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Compability");
8667  return false;
8668  }
8669  if(videoSettings.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags & OpenGLCompabilityFlags::Forward) {
8670  flags = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_FORWARD_COMPATIBLE_BIT_ARB;
8671  }
8672 
8673  int contextAttribIndex = 0;
8674  int contextAttribList[20 + 1] = {};
8675  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_MAJOR_VERSION_ARB;
8676  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = (int)videoSettings.graphics.opengl.majorVersion;
8677  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_MINOR_VERSION_ARB;
8678  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = (int)videoSettings.graphics.opengl.minorVersion;
8679  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_PROFILE_MASK_ARB;
8680  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = profile;
8681  if(flags > 0) {
8682  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = FPL_WGL_CONTEXT_FLAGS_ARB;
8683  contextAttribList[contextAttribIndex++] = flags;
8684  }
8685 
8686  // Create modern opengl rendering context
8687  HGLRC modernRenderingContext = glFuncs.wglCreateContextAttribsArb(deviceContext, 0, contextAttribList);
8688  if(modernRenderingContext) {
8689  if(!glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, modernRenderingContext)) {
8690  common::PushError("Warning: Failed activating Modern OpenGL Rendering Context for version (%d.%d) and compability flags (%d) and DC '%x') -> Fallback to legacy context", videoSettings.graphics.opengl.majorVersion, videoSettings.graphics.opengl.minorVersion, videoSettings.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags, deviceContext);
8691 
8692  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(modernRenderingContext);
8693  modernRenderingContext = nullptr;
8694 
8695  // Fallback to legacy context
8696  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
8697  activeRenderingContext = legacyRenderingContext;
8698  } else {
8699  // Destroy legacy rendering context
8700  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(legacyRenderingContext);
8701  legacyRenderingContext = nullptr;
8702  activeRenderingContext = modernRenderingContext;
8703  }
8704  } else {
8705  common::PushError("Warning: Failed creating Modern OpenGL Rendering Context for version (%d.%d) and compability flags (%d) and DC '%x') -> Fallback to legacy context", videoSettings.graphics.opengl.majorVersion, videoSettings.graphics.opengl.minorVersion, videoSettings.graphics.opengl.compabilityFlags, deviceContext);
8706 
8707  // Fallback to legacy context
8708  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
8709  activeRenderingContext = legacyRenderingContext;
8710  }
8711  } else {
8712  // Caller wants legacy context
8713  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(deviceContext, legacyRenderingContext);
8714  activeRenderingContext = legacyRenderingContext;
8715  }
8716 
8717  FPL_ASSERT(activeRenderingContext != nullptr);
8718 
8719  glState.renderingContext = activeRenderingContext;
8720 
8721  // Set vertical syncronisation if available
8722  if(glFuncs.wglSwapIntervalExt != nullptr) {
8723  int swapInterval = videoSettings.isVSync ? 1 : 0;
8724  glFuncs.wglSwapIntervalExt(swapInterval);
8725  }
8726 
8727  return true;
8728  }
8729 
8730  fpl_internal void Win32ReleaseVideoOpenGL(Win32VideoOpenGLState &glState) {
8731  Win32OpenGLFunctions &glFuncs = glState.glApi;
8732  if(glState.renderingContext) {
8733  glFuncs.wglMakeCurrent(nullptr, nullptr);
8734  glFuncs.wglDeleteContext(glState.renderingContext);
8735  }
8736  if(glFuncs.openglLibrary != nullptr) {
8737  ::FreeLibrary(glFuncs.openglLibrary);
8738  }
8739  glState = {};
8740  }
8741 # endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
8742 
8743 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
8744 
8745 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
8746 
8747 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
8748  struct Win32VideoSoftwareState {
8749  BITMAPINFO bitmapInfo;
8750  };
8751 
8752  fpl_internal bool Win32InitVideoSoftware(const video::VideoBackBuffer &backbuffer, Win32VideoSoftwareState &software) {
8753  software = {};
8754  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biSize = sizeof(BITMAPINFOHEADER);
8755  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biWidth = (LONG)backbuffer.width;
8756  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biHeight = (LONG)backbuffer.height;
8757  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biBitCount = 32;
8758  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biCompression = BI_RGB;
8759  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biPlanes = 1;
8760  software.bitmapInfo.bmiHeader.biSizeImage = (DWORD)(backbuffer.height * backbuffer.lineWidth);
8761  return true;
8762  }
8763 
8764  fpl_internal void Win32ReleaseVideoSoftware(Win32VideoSoftwareState &softwareState) {
8765  softwareState = {};
8766  }
8767 # endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
8768 
8769 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
8770  }
8771 }
8772 
8773 // ****************************************************************************
8774 //
8775 // Audio Drivers
8776 //
8777 // ****************************************************************************
8778 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
8779 # include <mmreg.h>
8780 # include <dsound.h>
8781 #endif
8782 namespace fpl {
8783  namespace drivers {
8784 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
8785  //
8786  // DirectSound
8787  //
8788 # define FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_CREATE(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(const GUID* pcGuidDevice, LPDIRECTSOUND *ppDS8, LPUNKNOWN pUnkOuter)
8789  typedef FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_CREATE(func_DirectSoundCreate);
8790 # define FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_ENUMERATE_A(name) HRESULT WINAPI name(LPDSENUMCALLBACKA pDSEnumCallback, LPVOID pContext)
8791  typedef FPL_FUNC_DIRECT_SOUND_ENUMERATE_A(func_DirectSoundEnumerateA);
8792 
8793  static const GUID FPL_IID_IDirectSoundNotify = { 0xb0210783, 0x89cd, 0x11d0, {0xaf, 0x08, 0x00, 0xa0, 0xc9, 0x25, 0xcd, 0x16} };
8794 
8795  fpl_constant uint32_t FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS = 4;
8796 
8797  struct DirectSoundState {
8798  HMODULE dsoundLibrary;
8799  LPDIRECTSOUND directSound;
8800  LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER primaryBuffer;
8801  LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER secondaryBuffer;
8802  LPDIRECTSOUNDNOTIFY notify;
8803  HANDLE notifyEvents[FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS];
8804  HANDLE stopEvent;
8805  uint32_t lastProcessedFrame;
8806  bool breakMainLoop;
8807  };
8808 
8809  struct DirectSoundDeviceInfos {
8810  uint32_t foundDeviceCount;
8811  AudioDeviceID *devices;
8812  uint32_t maxDeviceCount;
8813  };
8814 
8815  fpl_internal BOOL CALLBACK GetDeviceCallbackDirectSound(LPGUID lpGuid, LPCSTR lpcstrDescription, LPCSTR lpcstrModule, LPVOID lpContext) {
8816  (void)lpcstrModule;
8817 
8818  DirectSoundDeviceInfos *infos = (DirectSoundDeviceInfos *)lpContext;
8819  FPL_ASSERT(infos != nullptr);
8820  if(infos->devices != nullptr) {
8821  uint32_t index = infos->foundDeviceCount++;
8822  if(index < infos->maxDeviceCount) {
8823  AudioDeviceID *deviceId = infos->devices + index;
8824  *deviceId = {};
8825  strings::CopyAnsiString(lpcstrDescription, deviceId->name, FPL_ARRAYCOUNT(deviceId->name));
8826  if(lpGuid != nullptr) {
8827  memory::MemoryCopy(lpGuid, sizeof(deviceId->dshow), &deviceId->dshow);
8828  }
8829  return TRUE;
8830  }
8831  }
8832  return FALSE;
8833  }
8834 
8835  fpl_internal uint32_t GetDevicesDirectSound(DirectSoundState &dsoundState, AudioDeviceID *devices, uint32_t maxDeviceCount) {
8836  uint32_t result = 0;
8837  func_DirectSoundEnumerateA *directSoundEnumerateA = (func_DirectSoundEnumerateA *)::GetProcAddress(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary, "DirectSoundEnumerateA");
8838  if(directSoundEnumerateA != nullptr) {
8839  DirectSoundDeviceInfos infos = {};
8840  infos.maxDeviceCount = maxDeviceCount;
8841  infos.devices = devices;
8842  directSoundEnumerateA(GetDeviceCallbackDirectSound, &infos);
8843  result = infos.foundDeviceCount;
8844  }
8845  return(result);
8846  }
8847 
8848  fpl_internal bool ReleaseDirectSound(const common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
8849  if(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary != nullptr) {
8850  if(dsoundState.stopEvent != nullptr) {
8851  ::CloseHandle(dsoundState.stopEvent);
8852  }
8853 
8854  for(uint32_t i = 0; i < commonAudio.internalFormat.periods; ++i) {
8855  if(dsoundState.notifyEvents[i]) {
8856  ::CloseHandle(dsoundState.notifyEvents[i]);
8857  }
8858  }
8859 
8860  if(dsoundState.notify != nullptr) {
8861  dsoundState.notify->Release();
8862  }
8863 
8864  if(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer != nullptr) {
8865  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Release();
8866  }
8867 
8868  if(dsoundState.primaryBuffer != nullptr) {
8869  dsoundState.primaryBuffer->Release();
8870  }
8871 
8872  if(dsoundState.directSound != nullptr) {
8873  dsoundState.directSound->Release();
8874  }
8875 
8876  ::FreeLibrary(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary);
8877  dsoundState = {};
8878  }
8879 
8880  return true;
8881  }
8882 
8883  fpl_internal audio::AudioResult InitDirectSound(const AudioSettings &audioSettings, common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
8884  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
8885  platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
8886  platform::Win32AppState &win32AppState = appState->win32;
8887  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &apiFuncs = win32AppState.winApi;
8888 
8889  // Load direct sound library
8890  dsoundState.dsoundLibrary = ::LoadLibraryA("dsound.dll");
8891  func_DirectSoundCreate *directSoundCreate = (func_DirectSoundCreate *)::GetProcAddress(dsoundState.dsoundLibrary, "DirectSoundCreate");
8892  if(directSoundCreate == nullptr) {
8893  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8894  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8895  }
8896 
8897  // Load direct sound object
8898  const GUID *deviceId = nullptr;
8899  if(strings::GetAnsiStringLength(audioSettings.deviceID.name) > 0) {
8900  deviceId = &audioSettings.deviceID.dshow;
8901  }
8902  if(!SUCCEEDED(directSoundCreate(deviceId, &dsoundState.directSound, nullptr))) {
8903  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8904  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8905  }
8906 
8907  // Setup wave format ex
8908  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE wf = {};
8909  wf.Format.cbSize = sizeof(wf);
8910  wf.Format.wFormatTag = WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE;
8911  wf.Format.nChannels = (WORD)audioSettings.deviceFormat.channels;
8912  wf.Format.nSamplesPerSec = (DWORD)audioSettings.deviceFormat.sampleRate;
8913  wf.Format.wBitsPerSample = audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(audioSettings.deviceFormat.type) * 8;
8914  wf.Format.nBlockAlign = (wf.Format.nChannels * wf.Format.wBitsPerSample) / 8;
8915  wf.Format.nAvgBytesPerSec = wf.Format.nBlockAlign * wf.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
8916  wf.Samples.wValidBitsPerSample = wf.Format.wBitsPerSample;
8917  if((audioSettings.deviceFormat.type == AudioFormatType::F32) || (audioSettings.deviceFormat.type == AudioFormatType::F64)) {
8918  wf.SubFormat = KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT;
8919  } else {
8920  wf.SubFormat = KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM;
8921  }
8922 
8923  // Get either local window handle or desktop handle
8924  HWND windowHandle = nullptr;
8925 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
8926  if(appState->initFlags & InitFlags::Window) {
8927  windowHandle = appState->window.win32.windowHandle;
8928  }
8929 # endif
8930  if(windowHandle == nullptr) {
8931  windowHandle = apiFuncs.user.getDesktopWindow();
8932  }
8933 
8934  // The cooperative level must be set before doing anything else
8935  if(FAILED(dsoundState.directSound->SetCooperativeLevel(windowHandle, (audioSettings.preferExclusiveMode) ? DSSCL_EXCLUSIVE : DSSCL_PRIORITY))) {
8936  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8937  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8938  }
8939 
8940  // Create primary buffer
8941  DSBUFFERDESC descDSPrimary = {};
8942  descDSPrimary.dwSize = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
8943  descDSPrimary.dwFlags = DSBCAPS_PRIMARYBUFFER | DSBCAPS_CTRLVOLUME;
8944  if(FAILED(dsoundState.directSound->CreateSoundBuffer(&descDSPrimary, &dsoundState.primaryBuffer, nullptr))) {
8945  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8946  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8947  }
8948 
8949  // Set format
8950  if(FAILED(dsoundState.primaryBuffer->SetFormat((WAVEFORMATEX*)&wf))) {
8951  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8952  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8953  }
8954 
8955  // Get the required size in bytes
8956  DWORD requiredSize;
8957  if(FAILED(dsoundState.primaryBuffer->GetFormat(nullptr, 0, &requiredSize))) {
8958  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8959  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8960  }
8961 
8962  // Get actual format
8963  char rawdata[1024];
8964  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE* pActualFormat = (WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE*)rawdata;
8965  if(FAILED(dsoundState.primaryBuffer->GetFormat((WAVEFORMATEX*)pActualFormat, requiredSize, nullptr))) {
8966  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
8967  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
8968  }
8969 
8970  // Set internal format
8971  AudioDeviceFormat internalFormat = {};
8972  if(IsEqualGUID(pActualFormat->SubFormat, KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT)) {
8973  if(pActualFormat->Format.wBitsPerSample == 64) {
8974  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::F64;
8975  } else {
8976  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::F32;
8977  }
8978  } else {
8979  switch(pActualFormat->Format.wBitsPerSample) {
8980  case 8:
8981  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::U8;
8982  break;
8983  case 16:
8984  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S16;
8985  break;
8986  case 24:
8987  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S24;
8988  break;
8989  case 32:
8990  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S32;
8991  break;
8992  case 64:
8993  internalFormat.type = AudioFormatType::S64;
8994  break;
8995  }
8996  }
8997  internalFormat.channels = pActualFormat->Format.nChannels;
8998  internalFormat.sampleRate = pActualFormat->Format.nSamplesPerSec;
8999 
9000  // @NOTE(final): We divide up our playback buffer into this number of periods and let directsound notify us when one of it needs to play.
9001  internalFormat.periods = 2;
9002  internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames = audio::GetAudioBufferSizeInFrames(internalFormat.sampleRate, audioSettings.bufferSizeInMilliSeconds);
9003  internalFormat.bufferSizeInBytes = internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames * internalFormat.channels * audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(internalFormat.type);
9004 
9005  commonAudio.internalFormat = internalFormat;
9006 
9007  // Create secondary buffer
9008  DSBUFFERDESC descDS = {};
9009  descDS.dwSize = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
9010  descDS.dwFlags = DSBCAPS_CTRLPOSITIONNOTIFY | DSBCAPS_GLOBALFOCUS | DSBCAPS_GETCURRENTPOSITION2;
9011  descDS.dwBufferBytes = (DWORD)internalFormat.bufferSizeInBytes;
9012  descDS.lpwfxFormat = (WAVEFORMATEX*)&wf;
9013  if(FAILED(dsoundState.directSound->CreateSoundBuffer(&descDS, &dsoundState.secondaryBuffer, nullptr))) {
9014  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9015  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9016  }
9017 
9018  // Notifications are set up via a DIRECTSOUNDNOTIFY object which is retrieved from the buffer.
9019  if(FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->QueryInterface(FPL_IID_IDirectSoundNotify, (void**)&dsoundState.notify))) {
9020  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9021  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9022  }
9023 
9024  // Setup notifications
9025  uint32_t periodSizeInBytes = internalFormat.bufferSizeInBytes / internalFormat.periods;
9026  DSBPOSITIONNOTIFY notifyPoints[FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS];
9027  for(uint32_t i = 0; i < internalFormat.periods; ++i) {
9028  dsoundState.notifyEvents[i] = CreateEventA(nullptr, false, false, nullptr);
9029  if(dsoundState.notifyEvents[i] == nullptr) {
9030  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9031  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9032  }
9033 
9034  // The notification offset is in bytes.
9035  notifyPoints[i].dwOffset = i * periodSizeInBytes;
9036  notifyPoints[i].hEventNotify = dsoundState.notifyEvents[i];
9037  }
9038  if(FAILED(dsoundState.notify->SetNotificationPositions(internalFormat.periods, notifyPoints))) {
9039  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9040  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9041  }
9042 
9043  // Create stop event
9044  dsoundState.stopEvent = ::CreateEventA(nullptr, false, false, nullptr);
9045  if(dsoundState.stopEvent == nullptr) {
9046  ReleaseDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9047  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9048  }
9049 
9050  return audio::AudioResult::Success;
9051  }
9052 
9053  fpl_internal_inline void StopMainLoopDirectSound(DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9054  dsoundState.breakMainLoop = true;
9055  ::SetEvent(dsoundState.stopEvent);
9056  }
9057 
9058  fpl_internal bool GetCurrentFrameDirectSound(const common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState, uint32_t* pCurrentPos) {
9059  FPL_ASSERT(pCurrentPos != nullptr);
9060  *pCurrentPos = 0;
9061 
9062  FPL_ASSERT(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer != nullptr);
9063  DWORD dwCurrentPosition;
9064  if(FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->GetCurrentPosition(nullptr, &dwCurrentPosition))) {
9065  return false;
9066  }
9067 
9068  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.channels > 0);
9069  *pCurrentPos = (uint32_t)dwCurrentPosition / audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(commonAudio.internalFormat.type) / commonAudio.internalFormat.channels;
9070  return true;
9071  }
9072 
9073  fpl_internal uint32_t GetAvailableFramesDirectSound(const common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9074  // Get current frame from current play position
9075  uint32_t currentFrame;
9076  if(!GetCurrentFrameDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState, &currentFrame)) {
9077  return 0;
9078  }
9079 
9080  // In a playback device the last processed frame should always be ahead of the current frame. The space between
9081  // the last processed and current frame (moving forward, starting from the last processed frame) is the amount
9082  // of space available to write.
9083  uint32_t totalFrameCount = commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames;
9084  uint32_t committedBeg = currentFrame;
9085  uint32_t committedEnd;
9086  committedEnd = dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame;
9087  if(committedEnd <= committedBeg) {
9088  committedEnd += totalFrameCount;
9089  }
9090 
9091  uint32_t committedSize = (committedEnd - committedBeg);
9092  FPL_ASSERT(committedSize <= totalFrameCount);
9093 
9094  return totalFrameCount - committedSize;
9095  }
9096 
9097  fpl_internal uint32_t WaitForFramesDirectSound(const common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9098  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.sampleRate > 0);
9099  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.periods > 0);
9100 
9101  // The timeout to use for putting the thread to sleep is based on the size of the buffer and the period count.
9102  DWORD timeoutInMilliseconds = (commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames / (commonAudio.internalFormat.sampleRate / 1000)) / commonAudio.internalFormat.periods;
9103  if(timeoutInMilliseconds < 1) {
9104  timeoutInMilliseconds = 1;
9105  }
9106 
9107  // Copy event handles so we can wait for each one
9108  unsigned int eventCount = commonAudio.internalFormat.periods + 1;
9109  HANDLE pEvents[FPL_DIRECTSOUND_MAX_PERIODS + 1]; // +1 for the stop event.
9110  memory::MemoryCopy(dsoundState.notifyEvents, sizeof(HANDLE) * commonAudio.internalFormat.periods, pEvents);
9111  pEvents[eventCount - 1] = dsoundState.stopEvent;
9112 
9113  while(!dsoundState.breakMainLoop) {
9114  // Get available frames from directsound
9115  uint32_t framesAvailable = GetAvailableFramesDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9116  if(framesAvailable > 0) {
9117  return framesAvailable;
9118  }
9119 
9120  // If we get here it means we weren't able to find any frames. We'll just wait here for a bit.
9121  ::WaitForMultipleObjects(eventCount, pEvents, FALSE, timeoutInMilliseconds);
9122  }
9123 
9124  // We'll get here if the loop was terminated. Just return whatever's available.
9125  return GetAvailableFramesDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9126  }
9127 
9128  fpl_internal bool StopDirectSound(DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9129  FPL_ASSERT(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer != nullptr);
9130  if(FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Stop())) {
9131  return false;
9132  }
9133  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->SetCurrentPosition(0);
9134  return true;
9135  }
9136 
9137  fpl_internal audio::AudioResult StartDirectSound(const common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9138  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.channels > 0);
9139  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.periods > 0);
9140  uint32_t audioSampleSizeBytes = audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(commonAudio.internalFormat.type);
9141  FPL_ASSERT(audioSampleSizeBytes > 0);
9142 
9143  // Before playing anything we need to grab an initial group of samples from the client.
9144  uint32_t framesToRead = commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames / commonAudio.internalFormat.periods;
9145  uint32_t desiredLockSize = framesToRead * commonAudio.internalFormat.channels * audioSampleSizeBytes;
9146 
9147  void* pLockPtr;
9148  DWORD actualLockSize;
9149  void* pLockPtr2;
9150  DWORD actualLockSize2;
9151  if(SUCCEEDED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Lock(0, desiredLockSize, &pLockPtr, &actualLockSize, &pLockPtr2, &actualLockSize2, 0))) {
9152  framesToRead = actualLockSize / audioSampleSizeBytes / commonAudio.internalFormat.channels;
9153  common::ReadAudioFramesFromClient(commonAudio, framesToRead, pLockPtr);
9154  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Unlock(pLockPtr, actualLockSize, pLockPtr2, actualLockSize2);
9155  dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame = framesToRead;
9156  if(FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Play(0, 0, DSBPLAY_LOOPING))) {
9157  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9158  }
9159  } else {
9160  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9161  }
9162  return audio::AudioResult::Success;
9163  }
9164 
9165  fpl_internal void DirectSoundMainLoop(const common::CommonAudioState &commonAudio, DirectSoundState &dsoundState) {
9166  FPL_ASSERT(commonAudio.internalFormat.channels > 0);
9167  uint32_t audioSampleSizeBytes = audio::GetAudioSampleSizeInBytes(commonAudio.internalFormat.type);
9168  FPL_ASSERT(audioSampleSizeBytes > 0);
9169 
9170  // Make sure the stop event is not signaled to ensure we don't end up immediately returning from WaitForMultipleObjects().
9171  ::ResetEvent(dsoundState.stopEvent);
9172 
9173  // Main loop
9174  dsoundState.breakMainLoop = false;
9175  while(!dsoundState.breakMainLoop) {
9176  // Wait until we get available frames from directsound
9177  uint32_t framesAvailable = WaitForFramesDirectSound(commonAudio, dsoundState);
9178  if(framesAvailable == 0) {
9179  continue;
9180  }
9181 
9182  // Don't bother grabbing more data if the device is being stopped.
9183  if(dsoundState.breakMainLoop) {
9184  break;
9185  }
9186 
9187  // Lock playback buffer
9188  DWORD lockOffset = dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame * commonAudio.internalFormat.channels * audioSampleSizeBytes;
9189  DWORD lockSize = framesAvailable * commonAudio.internalFormat.channels * audioSampleSizeBytes;
9190  {
9191  void* pLockPtr;
9192  DWORD actualLockSize;
9193  void* pLockPtr2;
9194  DWORD actualLockSize2;
9195  if(FAILED(dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Lock(lockOffset, lockSize, &pLockPtr, &actualLockSize, &pLockPtr2, &actualLockSize2, 0))) {
9196  // @TODO(final): Handle error
9197  break;
9198  }
9199 
9200  // Read actual frames from user
9201  uint32_t frameCount = actualLockSize / audioSampleSizeBytes / commonAudio.internalFormat.channels;
9202  common::ReadAudioFramesFromClient(commonAudio, frameCount, pLockPtr);
9203  dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame = (dsoundState.lastProcessedFrame + frameCount) % commonAudio.internalFormat.bufferSizeInFrames;
9204 
9205  // Unlock playback buffer
9206  dsoundState.secondaryBuffer->Unlock(pLockPtr, actualLockSize, pLockPtr2, actualLockSize2);
9207  }
9208  }
9209  }
9210 # endif //FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND
9211 
9212  } // drivers
9213 } // fpl
9214 
9215 // ****************************************************************************
9216 //
9217 // Platform Independent (Audio)
9218 //
9219 // The audio system is based on a stripped down version of "mini_al.h" by David Reid.
9220 // See: https://github.com/dr-soft/mini_al
9221 //
9222 // ****************************************************************************
9223 namespace fpl {
9224 
9225  namespace common {
9226  //
9227  // Audio
9228  //
9229 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
9230  enum class AudioDeviceState : uint32_t {
9231  Uninitialized = 0,
9232  Stopped,
9233  Started,
9234  Starting,
9235  Stopping,
9236  };
9237 
9238  struct AudioState {
9239  CommonAudioState common;
9240 
9241  threading::ThreadMutex lock;
9242  threading::ThreadContext *workerThread;
9243  threading::ThreadSignal startSignal;
9244  threading::ThreadSignal stopSignal;
9245  threading::ThreadSignal wakeupSignal;
9246  volatile AudioDeviceState state;
9247  volatile audio::AudioResult workResult;
9248 
9249  AudioDriverType activeDriver;
9250  uint32_t periods;
9251  uint32_t bufferSizeInFrames;
9252  uint32_t bufferSizeInBytes;
9253  bool isAsyncDriver;
9254 
9255  union {
9256 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9257  drivers::DirectSoundState dsound;
9258 # endif
9259  };
9260  };
9261 
9262  fpl_internal void AudioDeviceStopMainLoop(AudioState &audioState) {
9263  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9264  switch(audioState.activeDriver) {
9265 
9266 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9267  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9268  {
9269  drivers::StopMainLoopDirectSound(audioState.dsound);
9270  } break;
9271 # endif
9272 
9273  default:
9274  break;
9275  }
9276  }
9277 
9278  fpl_internal bool AudioReleaseDevice(AudioState &audioState) {
9279  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9280  bool result = false;
9281  switch(audioState.activeDriver) {
9282 
9283 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9284  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9285  {
9286  result = drivers::ReleaseDirectSound(audioState.common, audioState.dsound);
9287  } break;
9288 # endif
9289 
9290  default:
9291  break;
9292  }
9293  return (result);
9294  }
9295 
9296  fpl_internal bool AudioStopDevice(AudioState &audioState) {
9297  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9298  bool result = false;
9299  switch(audioState.activeDriver) {
9300 
9301 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9302  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9303  {
9304  result = drivers::StopDirectSound(audioState.dsound);
9305  } break;
9306 # endif
9307 
9308  default:
9309  break;
9310  }
9311  return (result);
9312  }
9313 
9314  fpl_internal audio::AudioResult AudioStartDevice(AudioState &audioState) {
9315  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9316  audio::AudioResult result = audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9317  switch(audioState.activeDriver) {
9318 
9319 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9320  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9321  {
9322  result = drivers::StartDirectSound(audioState.common, audioState.dsound);
9323  } break;
9324 # endif
9325 
9326  default:
9327  break;
9328  }
9329  return (result);
9330  }
9331 
9332  fpl_internal void AudioDeviceMainLoop(AudioState &audioState) {
9333  FPL_ASSERT(audioState.activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto);
9334  switch(audioState.activeDriver) {
9335 
9336 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9337  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9338  {
9339  drivers::DirectSoundMainLoop(audioState.common, audioState.dsound);
9340  } break;
9341 # endif
9342 
9343  default:
9344  break;
9345  }
9346  }
9347 
9348  fpl_internal_inline bool IsAudioDriverAsync(AudioDriverType audioDriver) {
9349  switch(audioDriver) {
9350  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9351  return false;
9352  default:
9353  return false;
9354  }
9355  }
9356 
9357  fpl_internal_inline void AudioSetDeviceState(AudioState &audioState, AudioDeviceState newState) {
9358  atomics::AtomicStoreU32((volatile uint32_t *)&audioState.state, (uint32_t)newState);
9359  }
9360 
9361  fpl_internal_inline AudioDeviceState AudioGetDeviceState(AudioState &audioState) {
9362  AudioDeviceState result = (AudioDeviceState)atomics::AtomicLoadU32((volatile uint32_t *)&audioState.state);
9363  return(result);
9364  }
9365 
9366  fpl_internal_inline bool IsAudioDeviceInitialized(AudioState *audioState) {
9367  if(audioState == nullptr) {
9368  return false;
9369  }
9370  AudioDeviceState state = AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState);
9371  return(state != AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized);
9372  }
9373 
9374  fpl_internal_inline bool IsAudioDeviceStarted(AudioState *audioState) {
9375  if(audioState == nullptr) {
9376  return false;
9377  }
9378  AudioDeviceState state = AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState);
9379  return(state == AudioDeviceState::Started);
9380  }
9381 
9382  fpl_internal void AudioWorkerThread(const threading::ThreadContext &context, void *data) {
9383 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9384  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
9385  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__AppState->win32.winApi;
9386 # endif
9387 
9388  AudioState *audioState = (AudioState *)data;
9389  FPL_ASSERT(audioState != nullptr);
9390  FPL_ASSERT(audioState->activeDriver != AudioDriverType::None);
9391 
9392 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9393  wapi.ole.coInitializeEx(nullptr, 0);
9394 # endif
9395 
9396  for(;;) {
9397  // Stop the device at the start of the iteration always
9398  AudioStopDevice(*audioState);
9399 
9400  // Let the other threads know that the device has been stopped.
9401  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Stopped);
9402  threading::SignalSet(audioState->stopSignal);
9403 
9404  // We wait until the audio device gets wake up
9405  threading::SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->wakeupSignal);
9406 
9407  // Default result code.
9408  audioState->workResult = audio::AudioResult::Success;
9409 
9410  // Just break if we're terminating.
9411  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized) {
9412  break;
9413  }
9414 
9415  // Expect that the device is currently be started by the client
9416  FPL_ASSERT(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Starting);
9417 
9418  // Start audio device
9419  audioState->workResult = AudioStartDevice(*audioState);
9420  if(audioState->workResult != audio::AudioResult::Success) {
9421  threading::SignalSet(audioState->startSignal);
9422  continue;
9423  }
9424 
9425  // The audio device is started, mark it as such
9426  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Started);
9427  threading::SignalSet(audioState->startSignal);
9428 
9429  // Enter audio device main loop
9430  AudioDeviceMainLoop(*audioState);
9431  }
9432 
9433  // Signal to stop any audio threads, in case there are some waiting
9434  threading::SignalSet(audioState->stopSignal);
9435 
9436 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9437  wapi.ole.coUninitialize();
9438 # endif
9439  }
9440 
9441  fpl_internal AudioState *AllocateAudioState(platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState) {
9442  platAudioState = {};
9443  platAudioState.memSize = sizeof(AudioState);
9444  platAudioState.mem = memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(platAudioState.memSize, 16);
9445  AudioState *result = (AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
9446  return(result);
9447  }
9448 
9449  fpl_internal void FreeAudioState(platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState) {
9450  if(platAudioState.mem != nullptr) {
9451  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(platAudioState.mem);
9452  }
9453  platAudioState = {};
9454  }
9455 
9456  fpl_internal void ReleaseAudio() {
9457 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9458  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
9459  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__AppState->win32.winApi;
9460 # endif
9461 
9462  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
9463 
9464  if(platAudioState.mem != nullptr) {
9465  AudioState *audioState = (AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
9466 
9467  if(IsAudioDeviceInitialized(audioState)) {
9468 
9469  // Wait until the audio device is stopped
9470  if(IsAudioDeviceStarted(audioState)) {
9471  while(audio::StopAudio() == audio::AudioResult::DeviceBusy) {
9472  threading::ThreadSleep(1);
9473  }
9474  }
9475 
9476  // Putting the device into an uninitialized state will make the worker thread return.
9477  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized);
9478 
9479  // Wake up the worker thread and wait for it to properly terminate.
9480  SignalSet(audioState->wakeupSignal);
9481  ThreadWaitForOne(audioState->workerThread);
9482  ThreadDestroy(audioState->workerThread);
9483 
9484  // Release signals and thread
9485  threading::SignalDestroy(audioState->stopSignal);
9486  threading::SignalDestroy(audioState->startSignal);
9487  threading::SignalDestroy(audioState->wakeupSignal);
9488  threading::MutexDestroy(audioState->lock);
9489 
9490  // Release audio device
9491  AudioReleaseDevice(*audioState);
9492  }
9493 
9494  // Release state memory
9495  FreeAudioState(platAudioState);
9496  }
9497 
9498 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9499  wapi.ole.coUninitialize();
9500 # endif
9501  }
9502 
9503  fpl_internal audio::AudioResult InitAudio(const AudioSettings &audioSettings) {
9504 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9505  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
9506  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = platform::global__AppState->win32.winApi;
9507 # endif
9508 
9509  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
9510  FPL_ASSERT(platAudioState.mem == nullptr);
9511  AudioState *audioState = AllocateAudioState(platAudioState);
9512 
9513  if(audioState->activeDriver != AudioDriverType::None) {
9514  FreeAudioState(platAudioState);
9515  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9516  }
9517 
9518  if(audioSettings.deviceFormat.channels == 0) {
9519  FreeAudioState(platAudioState);
9520  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9521  }
9522  if(audioSettings.deviceFormat.sampleRate == 0) {
9523  FreeAudioState(platAudioState);
9524  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9525  }
9526  if(audioSettings.bufferSizeInMilliSeconds == 0) {
9527  FreeAudioState(platAudioState);
9528  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9529  }
9530 
9531  audioState->common.clientReadCallback = audioSettings.clientReadCallback;
9532  audioState->common.clientUserData = audioSettings.userData;
9533 
9534 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9535  wapi.ole.coInitializeEx(nullptr, 0);
9536 # endif
9537 
9538  // Create mutex and signals
9539  audioState->lock = threading::MutexCreate();
9540  if(!audioState->lock.isValid) {
9541  ReleaseAudio();
9542  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9543  }
9544  audioState->wakeupSignal = threading::SignalCreate();
9545  if(!audioState->wakeupSignal.isValid) {
9546  ReleaseAudio();
9547  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9548  }
9549  audioState->startSignal = threading::SignalCreate();
9550  if(!audioState->startSignal.isValid) {
9551  ReleaseAudio();
9552  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9553  }
9554  audioState->stopSignal = threading::SignalCreate();
9555  if(!audioState->stopSignal.isValid) {
9556  ReleaseAudio();
9557  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9558  }
9559 
9560  // Prope drivers
9561  AudioDriverType propeDrivers[16];
9562  uint32_t driverCount = 0;
9563  if(audioSettings.driver == AudioDriverType::Auto) {
9564  // @NOTE(final): Add all audio drivers here, regardless of the platform.
9565  propeDrivers[driverCount++] = AudioDriverType::DirectSound;
9566  } else {
9567  // @NOTE(final): Forced audio driver
9568  propeDrivers[driverCount++] = audioSettings.driver;
9569  }
9570  audio::AudioResult initResult = audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9571  for(uint32_t driverIndex = 0; driverIndex < driverCount; ++driverIndex) {
9572  AudioDriverType propeDriver = propeDrivers[driverIndex];
9573 
9574  initResult = audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9575  switch(propeDriver) {
9576 
9577 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
9578  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
9579  {
9580  initResult = drivers::InitDirectSound(audioSettings, audioState->common, audioState->dsound);
9581  if(initResult != audio::AudioResult::Success) {
9582  drivers::ReleaseDirectSound(audioState->common, audioState->dsound);
9583  }
9584  } break;
9585 # endif
9586 
9587  default:
9588  break;
9589  }
9590  if(initResult == audio::AudioResult::Success) {
9591  audioState->activeDriver = propeDriver;
9592  audioState->isAsyncDriver = IsAudioDriverAsync(propeDriver);
9593  break;
9594  }
9595  }
9596 
9597  if(initResult != audio::AudioResult::Success) {
9598  ReleaseAudio();
9599  return initResult;
9600  }
9601 
9602  if(!audioState->isAsyncDriver) {
9603  // Create and start worker thread
9604  audioState->workerThread = threading::ThreadCreate(AudioWorkerThread, audioState);
9605  if(audioState->workerThread == nullptr) {
9606  ReleaseAudio();
9607  return audio::AudioResult::Failed;
9608  }
9609  // Wait for the worker thread to put the device into the stopped state.
9610  SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->stopSignal);
9611  } else {
9612  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Stopped);
9613  }
9614 
9615  FPL_ASSERT(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopped);
9616 
9617  return(audio::AudioResult::Success);
9618  }
9619 
9620 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
9621 
9622 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
9623  fpl_internal bool InitWindow(const Settings &initSettings, WindowSettings &currentWindowSettings, platform::PlatformAppState *appState, const WindowForVideoSettings &windowForVideoSettings, platform::callback_PrepareWindowForVideoAfter *prepareWindowForVideoAfter) {
9624  bool result = false;
9625  if(appState != nullptr) {
9626 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9627  result = platform::Win32InitWindow(initSettings, currentWindowSettings, appState, appState->win32, appState->window.win32, prepareWindowForVideoAfter);
9628 # elif defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11)
9629  // @TODO(final): Implement this!
9630  // For GLX you have to do the following steps:
9631  // - windowForVideoSettings.beforeCallback() to get a XVisualInfo back.
9632  // - Create a colormap from with that visual info
9633  // - Pass the colormap to the XSetWindowAttributes
9634  // - Create the video with the properties
9635  // See: https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Programming_OpenGL_in_Linux:_GLX_and_Xlib
9636 # endif
9637  }
9638  return (result);
9639  }
9640 
9641  fpl_internal void ReleaseWindow(const platform::PlatformInitState &initState, platform::PlatformAppState *appState) {
9642  if(appState != nullptr) {
9643 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9644  platform::Win32ReleaseWindow(initState.win32, appState->win32, appState->window.win32);
9645 # endif
9646  }
9647  }
9648 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
9649 
9650 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
9651  struct VideoState {
9652  union {
9653 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9654  struct {
9655 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
9656  drivers::Win32VideoOpenGLState opengl;
9657 # endif
9658 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
9659  drivers::Win32VideoSoftwareState software;
9660 # endif
9661  } win32;
9662 # endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
9663  };
9664 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
9665  video::VideoBackBuffer softwareBackbuffer;
9666 # endif
9667  };
9668 
9669  fpl_internal void ReleaseVideo(platform::PlatformAppState *appState) {
9670  if(appState != nullptr) {
9671  if(appState->video.mem != nullptr) {
9672  VideoState *videoState = (VideoState *)appState->video.mem;
9673 
9674  switch(appState->currentSettings.video.driver) {
9675 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
9676  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
9677  {
9678 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9679  drivers::Win32ReleaseVideoOpenGL(videoState->win32.opengl);
9680 # endif
9681  } break;
9682 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
9683 
9684 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
9685  case VideoDriverType::Software:
9686  {
9687 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9688  drivers::Win32ReleaseVideoSoftware(videoState->win32.software);
9689 # endif
9690  } break;
9691 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
9692 
9693  default:
9694  {
9695  } break;
9696  }
9697 
9698 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
9699  fpl::video::VideoBackBuffer &backbuffer = videoState->softwareBackbuffer;
9700  if(backbuffer.pixels != nullptr) {
9701  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(backbuffer.pixels);
9702  }
9703  backbuffer = {};
9704 # endif
9705 
9706  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(appState->video.mem);
9707  appState->video = {};
9708  }
9709  appState->currentSettings.video.driver = VideoDriverType::None;
9710  }
9711  }
9712 
9713  fpl_internal FPL_FUNC_PREPARE_WINDOW_FOR_VIDEO_AFTER(PrepareWindowForVideoAfter) {
9714  switch(videoSettings.driver) {
9715 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
9716  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
9717  {
9718 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9719  if(!drivers::Win32PrepareWindowForOpenGL(appState->win32, appState->window.win32, videoSettings)) {
9720  return false;
9721  }
9722 #
9723 # endif
9724  } break;
9725 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
9726 
9727  default:
9728  {
9729  } break;
9730  }
9731  return true;
9732  }
9733 
9734  fpl_internal FPL_FUNC_PREPARE_WINDOW_FOR_VIDEO_BEFORE(PrepareWindowForVideoBefore) {
9735  platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
9736  FPL_ASSERT(appState != nullptr);
9737  PrepareWindowForVideoResult result = {};
9738  switch(videoSettings.driver) {
9739 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
9740  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
9741  {
9742 # if defined(FPL_SUBPLATFORM_X11)
9743 # endif
9744  } break;
9745 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
9746 
9747  default:
9748  {
9749  } break;
9750  }
9751  return(result);
9752  }
9753 
9754  fpl_internal bool InitVideo(const VideoDriverType driver, const VideoSettings &videoSettings, const uint32_t windowWidth, const uint32_t windowHeight, platform::PlatformAppState *appState) {
9755  // @NOTE(final): Video drivers are platform independent, so we cannot have to same system as audio.
9756 
9757  if(appState != nullptr) {
9758  FPL_ASSERT(appState->video.mem == nullptr);
9759  appState->video.memSize = sizeof(common::VideoState);
9760  appState->video.mem = memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(appState->video.memSize, 16);
9761  if(appState->video.mem == nullptr) {
9762  PushError("Failed allocating video state memory of %xu bytes", appState->video.memSize);
9763  return false;
9764  }
9765 
9766  VideoState *videoState = (VideoState *)appState->video.mem;
9767  appState->currentSettings.video.driver = driver;
9768 
9769  // Allocate backbuffer context if needed
9770 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
9771  if(driver == VideoDriverType::Software) {
9772  fpl::video::VideoBackBuffer &backbuffer = videoState->softwareBackbuffer;
9773  backbuffer.width = windowWidth;
9774  backbuffer.height = windowHeight;
9775  backbuffer.pixelStride = sizeof(uint32_t);
9776  backbuffer.lineWidth = backbuffer.width * backbuffer.pixelStride;
9777  size_t size = backbuffer.lineWidth * backbuffer.height;
9778  backbuffer.pixels = (uint32_t *)memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(size, 16);
9779  if(backbuffer.pixels == nullptr) {
9780  PushError("Failed allocating video software backbuffer of size %xu bytes", size);
9781  ReleaseVideo(appState);
9782  return false;
9783  }
9784 
9785  // Clear to black by default
9786  // @NOTE(final): Bitmap is top-down, 0xAABBGGRR
9787  // @TODO(final): Backbuffer endianess???
9788  uint32_t *p = backbuffer.pixels;
9789  for(uint32_t y = 0; y < backbuffer.height; ++y) {
9790  uint32_t color = 0xFF000000;
9791  for(uint32_t x = 0; x < backbuffer.width; ++x) {
9792  *p++ = color;
9793  }
9794  }
9795  }
9796 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
9797 
9798  switch(driver) {
9799 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
9800  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
9801  {
9802 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9803  if(!drivers::Win32InitVideoOpenGL(appState->win32, appState->window.win32, videoSettings, videoState->win32.opengl)) {
9804  // @NOTE(final): Expect that errors are already written
9805  ReleaseVideo(appState);
9806  return false;
9807  }
9808 # endif
9809  } break;
9810 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL
9811 
9812 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
9813  case VideoDriverType::Software:
9814  {
9815 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9816  if(!drivers::Win32InitVideoSoftware(videoState->softwareBackbuffer, videoState->win32.software)) {
9817  // @NOTE(final): Expect that errors are already written
9818  ReleaseVideo(appState);
9819  return false;
9820  }
9821 # endif
9822  } break;
9823 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE
9824 
9825  default:
9826  {
9827  PushError("Unsupported video driver '%s' for this platform", fpl::video::GetVideoDriverString(videoSettings.driver));
9828  ReleaseVideo(appState);
9829  return false;
9830  } break;
9831  }
9832 
9833  }
9834 
9835  return true;
9836  }
9837 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
9838 
9839  fpl_internal void ReleasePlatformResources(platform::PlatformInitState &initState, platform::PlatformAppState *appState) {
9840 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
9841  ReleaseAudio();
9842 # endif
9843 
9844 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
9845  ReleaseVideo(appState);
9846 # endif
9847 
9848 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
9849  ReleaseWindow(initState, appState);
9850 # endif
9851 
9852  if(appState != nullptr) {
9853  // Release actual platform
9854 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
9855  platform::Win32ReleasePlatform(initState, appState);
9856 # elif defined(FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX)
9857  platform::LinuxReleasePlatform(initState, appState);
9858 # endif
9859 
9860  // Release platform applicatiom state memory
9861  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(appState);
9862  platform::global__AppState = nullptr;
9863  }
9864 
9865 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
9866  if(platform::global__EventQueue != nullptr) {
9867  memory::MemoryAlignedFree(platform::global__EventQueue);
9868  platform::global__EventQueue = nullptr;
9869  }
9870 # endif
9871 
9872  initState.isInitialized = false;
9873  }
9874 
9875  } // common
9876 
9877 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
9878  namespace audio {
9879  fpl_common_api AudioResult StopAudio() {
9880  using namespace common;
9881 
9882  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
9883  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
9884  if(platAudioState.mem == nullptr) {
9885  return AudioResult::Failed;
9886  }
9887  AudioState *audioState = (AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
9888 
9889  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Uninitialized) {
9890  return AudioResult::DeviceNotInitialized;
9891  }
9892 
9893  AudioResult result = AudioResult::Failed;
9894  MutexLock(audioState->lock);
9895  {
9896  // Check if the device is already stopped
9897  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopping) {
9898  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9899  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStopped;
9900  }
9901  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopped) {
9902  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9903  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStopped;
9904  }
9905 
9906  // The device needs to be in a started state. If it's not, we just let the caller know the device is busy.
9907  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) != AudioDeviceState::Started) {
9908  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9909  return AudioResult::DeviceBusy;
9910  }
9911 
9912  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Stopping);
9913 
9914  if(audioState->isAsyncDriver) {
9915  // Asynchronous drivers (Has their own thread)
9916  AudioStopDevice(*audioState);
9917  } else {
9918  // Synchronous drivers
9919 
9920  // The audio worker thread is most likely in a wait state, so let it stop properly.
9921  AudioDeviceStopMainLoop(*audioState);
9922 
9923  // We need to wait for the worker thread to become available for work before returning.
9924  // @NOTE(final): The audio worker thread will be the one who puts the device into the stopped state.
9925  SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->stopSignal);
9926  result = AudioResult::Success;
9927  }
9928  }
9929  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9930 
9931  return result;
9932  }
9933 
9934  fpl_common_api AudioResult PlayAudio() {
9935  using namespace common;
9936 
9937  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
9938  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
9939  if(platAudioState.mem == nullptr) {
9940  return AudioResult::Failed;
9941  }
9942  AudioState *audioState = (AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
9943 
9944  if(!IsAudioDeviceInitialized(audioState)) {
9945  return AudioResult::DeviceNotInitialized;
9946  }
9947 
9948  AudioResult result = AudioResult::Failed;
9949  MutexLock(audioState->lock);
9950  {
9951  // Be a bit more descriptive if the device is already started or is already in the process of starting.
9952  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Starting) {
9953  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9954  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStarted;
9955  }
9956  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Started) {
9957  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9958  return AudioResult::DeviceAlreadyStarted;
9959  }
9960 
9961  // The device needs to be in a stopped state. If it's not, we just let the caller know the device is busy.
9962  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) != AudioDeviceState::Stopped) {
9963  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9964  return AudioResult::DeviceBusy;
9965  }
9966 
9967  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Starting);
9968 
9969  if(audioState->isAsyncDriver) {
9970  // Asynchronous drivers (Has their own thread)
9971  AudioStartDevice(*audioState);
9972  AudioSetDeviceState(*audioState, AudioDeviceState::Started);
9973  } else {
9974  // Synchronous drivers
9975  SignalSet(audioState->wakeupSignal);
9976 
9977  // Wait for the worker thread to finish starting the device.
9978  // @NOTE(final): The audio worker thread will be the one who puts the device into the started state.
9979  SignalWaitForOne(audioState->lock, audioState->startSignal);
9980  result = audioState->workResult;
9981  }
9982  }
9983  MutexUnlock(audioState->lock);
9984 
9985  return result;
9986  }
9987 
9988  fpl_common_api AudioDeviceFormat GetAudioHardwareFormat() {
9989  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
9990  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
9991  if(platAudioState.mem == nullptr) {
9992  return {};
9993  }
9994  common::AudioState *audioState = (common::AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
9995  return audioState->common.internalFormat;
9996  }
9997 
9998  fpl_common_api void SetAudioClientReadCallback(AudioClientReadFunction *newCallback, void *userData) {
9999  using namespace common;
10000  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10001  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
10002  if(platAudioState.mem == nullptr) {
10003  return;
10004  }
10005  common::AudioState *audioState = (common::AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
10006  if(audioState->activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto) {
10007  if(AudioGetDeviceState(*audioState) == AudioDeviceState::Stopped) {
10008  audioState->common.clientReadCallback = newCallback;
10009  audioState->common.clientUserData = userData;
10010  }
10011  }
10012  }
10013 
10014  fpl_common_api uint32_t GetAudioDevices(AudioDeviceID *devices, uint32_t maxDeviceCount) {
10015  using namespace common;
10016  if(devices == nullptr) {
10017  return 0;
10018  }
10019  if(maxDeviceCount == 0) {
10020  return 0;
10021  }
10022 
10023  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10024  platform::PlatformAudioState &platAudioState = platform::global__AppState->audio;
10025  if(platAudioState.mem == nullptr) {
10026  return 0;
10027  }
10028  common::AudioState *audioState = (common::AudioState *)platAudioState.mem;
10029 
10030  uint32_t result = 0;
10031  if(audioState->activeDriver > AudioDriverType::Auto) {
10032  switch(audioState->activeDriver) {
10033 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO_DIRECTSOUND)
10034  case AudioDriverType::DirectSound:
10035  {
10036  result = drivers::GetDevicesDirectSound(audioState->dsound, devices, maxDeviceCount);
10037  } break;
10038 # endif
10039  }
10040  }
10041  return(result);
10042  }
10043  } // audio
10044 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
10045 
10046 #if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
10047  namespace video {
10048  fpl_common_api VideoBackBuffer *GetVideoBackBuffer() {
10049  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10050  platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
10051 
10052  VideoBackBuffer *result = nullptr;
10053  if(appState->video.mem != nullptr) {
10054  common::VideoState *videoState = (common::VideoState *)appState->video.mem;
10055 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
10056  if(appState->currentSettings.video.driver == VideoDriverType::Software) {
10057  result = &videoState->softwareBackbuffer;
10058  }
10059 # endif
10060  }
10061 
10062  return(result);
10063  }
10064 
10065  fpl_common_api VideoDriverType GetVideoDriver() {
10066  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10067  const platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
10068  VideoDriverType result = appState->currentSettings.video.driver;
10069  return(result);
10070  }
10071 
10072  fpl_common_api bool ResizeVideoBackBuffer(const uint32_t width, const uint32_t height) {
10073  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10074  platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
10075  platform::PlatformVideoState &video = appState->video;
10076 
10077  bool result = false;
10078 
10079  if(video.mem != nullptr) {
10080 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
10081  if(appState->currentSettings.video.driver == VideoDriverType::Software) {
10082  common::ReleaseVideo(appState);
10083  result = common::InitVideo(VideoDriverType::Software, appState->currentSettings.video, width, height, appState);
10084  }
10085 # endif
10086  }
10087 
10088  return (result);
10089  }
10090 
10091  fpl_common_api void VideoFlip() {
10092  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10093  const platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
10094  const platform::PlatformVideoState &video = appState->video;
10095 
10096  if(video.mem != nullptr) {
10097  const common::VideoState *videoState = (common::VideoState *)video.mem;
10098 
10099 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
10100  const platform::Win32AppState &win32AppState = appState->win32;
10101  const platform::Win32WindowState &win32WindowState = appState->window.win32;
10102  const platform::Win32APIFunctions &wapi = win32AppState.winApi;
10103  switch(appState->currentSettings.video.driver) {
10104 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_SOFTWARE)
10105  case VideoDriverType::Software:
10106  {
10107  const drivers::Win32VideoSoftwareState &software = videoState->win32.software;
10108  const video::VideoBackBuffer &backbuffer = videoState->softwareBackbuffer;
10109  window::WindowSize area = window::GetWindowArea();
10110  int32_t targetX = 0;
10111  int32_t targetY = 0;
10112  int32_t targetWidth = area.width;
10113  int32_t targetHeight = area.height;
10114  int32_t sourceWidth = backbuffer.width;
10115  int32_t sourceHeight = backbuffer.height;
10116  if(backbuffer.useOutputRect) {
10117  targetX = backbuffer.outputRect.x;
10118  targetY = backbuffer.outputRect.y;
10119  targetWidth = backbuffer.outputRect.width;
10120  targetHeight = backbuffer.outputRect.height;
10121  wapi.gdi.stretchDIBits(win32WindowState.deviceContext, 0, 0, area.width, area.height, 0, 0, 0, 0, nullptr, nullptr, DIB_RGB_COLORS, BLACKNESS);
10122  }
10123  wapi.gdi.stretchDIBits(win32WindowState.deviceContext, targetX, targetY, targetWidth, targetHeight, 0, 0, sourceWidth, sourceHeight, backbuffer.pixels, &software.bitmapInfo, DIB_RGB_COLORS, SRCCOPY);
10124  } break;
10125 # endif
10126 
10127 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO_OPENGL)
10128  case VideoDriverType::OpenGL:
10129  {
10130  wapi.gdi.swapBuffers(win32WindowState.deviceContext);
10131  } break;
10132 # endif
10133 
10134  default:
10135  break;
10136  }
10137 # endif // FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32
10138  }
10139  }
10140  } // video
10141 #endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
10142 
10143  fpl_common_api const char *GetPlatformError() {
10144  const char *result = "";
10145  const common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
10146 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
10147  if(errorState.count > 0) {
10148  size_t index = errorState.count - 1;
10149  result = GetPlatformError(index);
10150  }
10151 # else
10152  result = errorState.errors[0];
10153 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
10154  return (result);
10155  }
10156 
10157  fpl_common_api const char *GetPlatformError(const size_t index) {
10158  const char *result = "";
10159  const common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
10160 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES)
10161  if(index > -1 && index < (int32_t)errorState.count) {
10162  result = errorState.errors[index];
10163  } else {
10164  result = errorState.errors[errorState.count - 1];
10165  }
10166 # else
10167  result = errorState.errors[0];
10168 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_MULTIPLE_ERRORSTATES
10169  return (result);
10170  }
10171 
10172  fpl_common_api size_t GetPlatformErrorCount() {
10173  size_t result = 0;
10174  const common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
10175  result = errorState.count;
10176  return (result);
10177  }
10178 
10179  fpl_common_api void ClearPlatformErrors() {
10180  common::ErrorState &errorState = common::global__LastErrorState;
10181  memory::MemoryClear(&errorState, sizeof(errorState));
10182  }
10183 
10184  fpl_common_api const Settings &GetCurrentSettings() {
10185  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState != nullptr);
10186  const platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
10187  return (appState->currentSettings);
10188  }
10189 
10190  fpl_common_api void ReleasePlatform() {
10191  // Exit out if platform is not initialized
10192  platform::PlatformInitState &initState = platform::global__InitState;
10193  if(!initState.isInitialized) {
10194  common::PushError("Platform is not initialized");
10195  return;
10196  }
10197  platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState;
10198  common::ReleasePlatformResources(initState, appState);
10199  }
10200 
10201  fpl_common_api bool InitPlatform(const InitFlags initFlags, const Settings &initSettings) {
10202  // Exit out if platform is already initialized
10203  if(platform::global__InitState.isInitialized) {
10204  common::PushError("Platform is already initialized");
10205  return false;
10206  }
10207 
10208  // Allocate platform app state memory
10209  FPL_ASSERT(platform::global__AppState == nullptr);
10210  size_t platformAppStateSize = sizeof(platform::PlatformAppState);
10211  void *platformAppStateMemory = memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(platformAppStateSize, 16);
10212  if(platformAppStateMemory == nullptr) {
10213  common::PushError("Failed allocating app state memory of size '%zu'", platformAppStateSize);
10214  return false;
10215  }
10216 
10217  // Setup platform app state
10218  platform::PlatformAppState *appState = platform::global__AppState = (platform::PlatformAppState *)platformAppStateMemory;
10219  appState->initSettings = initSettings;
10220  appState->initFlags = initFlags;
10221  appState->currentSettings = initSettings;
10222 
10223  // Reset platform init state
10224  platform::PlatformInitState &initState = platform::global__InitState;
10225  initState = {};
10226 
10227 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO) && defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
10228  // Window is required for video always
10229  if(appState->initFlags & InitFlags::Video) {
10230  appState->initFlags |= InitFlags::Window;
10231  }
10232 # endif
10233 
10234  // Initialize the actual platform
10235  bool isInitialized = false;
10236 # if defined(FPL_PLATFORM_WIN32)
10237  isInitialized = platform::Win32InitPlatform(appState->initFlags, initSettings, initState, appState);
10238 # elif defined(FPL_PLATFORM_LINUX)
10239  isInitialized = platform::LinuxInitPlatform(appState->initFlags, initSettings, initState, appState);
10240 # endif
10241 
10242  if(isInitialized) {
10243 
10244  // Init Window
10245 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW)
10246  if(appState->initFlags & InitFlags::Window) {
10247  // Allocate event queue
10248  size_t eventQueueMemorySize = sizeof(platform::EventQueue);
10249  void *eventQueueMemory = memory::MemoryAlignedAllocate(eventQueueMemorySize, 16);
10250  if(eventQueueMemory == nullptr) {
10251  common::PushError("Failed Allocating Event Queue Memory with size '%zu'", eventQueueMemorySize);
10252  common::ReleasePlatformResources(initState, appState);
10253  return false;
10254  }
10255  platform::global__EventQueue = (platform::EventQueue *)eventQueueMemory;
10256  if(!common::InitWindow(initSettings, appState->currentSettings.window, appState, appState->currentSettings.windowForVideo, common::PrepareWindowForVideoAfter)) {
10257  common::PushError("Failed initialization window");
10258  common::ReleasePlatformResources(initState, appState);
10259  return false;
10260  }
10261  }
10262 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_WINDOW
10263 
10264  // Init Video
10265 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO)
10266  if(appState->initFlags & InitFlags::Video) {
10267  uint32_t windowWidth, windowHeight;
10268  if(appState->currentSettings.window.isFullscreen) {
10269  windowWidth = appState->currentSettings.window.fullscreenWidth;
10270  windowHeight = appState->currentSettings.window.fullscreenHeight;
10271  } else {
10272  windowWidth = appState->currentSettings.window.windowWidth;
10273  windowHeight = appState->currentSettings.window.windowWidth;
10274  }
10275  if(!common::InitVideo(initSettings.video.driver, initSettings.video, windowWidth, windowHeight, appState)) {
10276  common::PushError("Failed initialization video with settings (Driver=%s, Width=%d, Height=%d)", video::GetVideoDriverString(initSettings.video.driver), windowWidth, windowHeight);
10277  common::ReleasePlatformResources(initState, appState);
10278  return false;
10279  }
10280  }
10281 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_VIDEO
10282 
10283  // Init Audio
10284 # if defined(FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO)
10285  if(appState->initFlags & InitFlags::Audio) {
10286  if(common::InitAudio(initSettings.audio) != audio::AudioResult::Success) {
10287  common::PushError("Failed initialization audio with settings (Driver=%s, Format=%s, SampleRate=%d, Channels=%d, BufferSize=%d)", audio::GetAudioDriverString(initSettings.audio.driver), audio::GetAudioFormatString(initSettings.audio.deviceFormat.type), initSettings.audio.deviceFormat.sampleRate, initSettings.audio.deviceFormat.channels);
10288  common::ReleasePlatformResources(initState, appState);
10289  return false;
10290  }
10291  }
10292 # endif // FPL_ENABLE_AUDIO
10293 
10294  initState.isInitialized = true;
10295  return true;
10296  } else {
10297  common::ReleasePlatformResources(initState, appState);
10298  return false;
10299  }
10300  }
10301 
10302 } // fpl
10303 
10304 #endif // FPL_IMPLEMENTATION && !FPL_IMPLEMENTED
